reviews.text: I had a really great time here the other night. The 10 dollar corking fee they charge is very reasonable, I thought the service was great as well. <br><br>We were celebrating and I had a bottle of Moët still kicking around from NYs eve that didn&#39;t get drank. So we figured we would bring it to the restaurant we were going to later that evening. <br><br>The first dish we ordered was the tuna tartar. I thought it was a poor representation of what they had to offer. I&#39;ve seen other reviews of it that are on par with my opinion...bland, small, an attempt at elegant food done poorly. The ring mold is meant for so much more in my opinion. It&#39;s an easy trick that needs more, to remain elegant, than they are offering up. Maybe some black sesame seeds in the tartar, and a sprinkle of togarashi. Or wrap it in nori, pour ginger broth around it, anything to add something. <br><br>The next plate we picked was the corn cakes. Those were good, and big, and tasty, and while I&#39;m adding all these ands, and very well thought out. I could have ordered two of them. Flavorful and simple but refined. Pretty much perfect. <br><br>The next course was the hibachi steak? I hope I&#39;m not butchering the name of that dish because it was stellar. It was recommended by our server. She claimed it was her favorite and I see why. It was soft and juicy, and everything on that plate was done well. I highly recommend it and might just have to get it one more time because life is short and yolo. <br><br>Last but not least, well at least last, was the cheesecake.. kind of the disappointment of the evening sorta but not all the way. I had mixed feelings I guess. <br><br>So I figured I can get or make a simple cheesecake anywhere so try something cool. Caramel apple was what I decided on. The cheesecake part was great. Light and fluffy as it should be, the crust was perfect, whipped cream was awesome. The part I wasn&#39;t fond of was the Apple part. When I think of a caramel apple I want a tart apple and sweet caramel to contrast. Instead this was apple that I would guess came out of a jar or pail of apple pie filling. It was mushy and tasted like cinnamon. Like the crap from the bucket in a bakery. That&#39;s not caramel apple like at all. <br><br>The math on those cakes works out to like 100 bucks a cake by the slice. I personally would want to make sure they make a pretty strong statement, especially since the place is named after them. <br><br>Besides that it was a great night. I had a lager from hop valley that I am trying to find in stores it was so good, and I left happy. I&#39;ll most likely be back soon because I really liked the ambiance.

So we ordered Cheesecake Factory as a treat tonight.  I spent almost $30 on fettuccine alfredo with shrimp..  this is what showed up.  This is a joke.  How can this place charge that much for food and serve this?

Oh, no<br>See you eating out like it&#39;s ephemeral<br>Not so serious, Aperol Spritz cold<br>We&#39;re just getting started, mix and mingle<br><br>Waistline killing masterpiece<br>You should Reese&#39;s and repeat <br>You&#39;re a dessert fantasy <br>But you DNCE so dangerously <br>Let&#39;s start Cherry Ghirardelli<br><br>Factory, baby<br>I&#39;m going blind from this sweet-sweet craving <br>Whoa-oh<br>Let&#39;s lose our minds and go Key Lime crazy<br>Ah ya ya ya ya <br>I keep on hoping we&#39;ll Cheesecake a commotion <br><br>Father&#39;s Day parfait<br>I&#39;ll be assembly, you&#39;ll oversee QC, whoa-oh<br>Let&#39;s lose our minds and Brunch Brûléed crazy<br>Ah ya ya ya ya <br>We keep eloping to Cheesecake with emotion

I&#39;m not really into food chain restaurants but this place is the one chain that I absolutely love! I&#39;ve been going to the one in Beaverton for years on special occasions and I was super excited to see one open on this side of town. What I like about this place is they have food for any kind of cravings you have! I always get something different when I come and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. Plus you get a huge portion that you can save for leftovers! The cheesecake is so delicious and I like to try something new each time I&#39;ve come. We are always too stuffed to eat dessert there so we bring it home. I especially like their complimentary brown bread that comes out warm and you can slather that sweet cream butter on it! I&#39;ve been meaning to come here on the weekend when they have brunch...I will one of these days and let you know what I think.
Great dishes, desserts and meals. I recommend you check this place out if you haven&#39;t been here. Very clean!

First time to the cheese cake factory but will definitely be coming back!! We had a gift card from last Christmas that we needed to use up. This restaurant is at the mall which l avoid like the plague! But there&#39;s a pair of shoes on sale that my granddaughter wanted for Christmas, so we thought why not. Seating was prompt, the restaurant was large and busy. The menu was like a small novel soo many choices! We like to share to get more choices. Our server Rebecca was on point, and helpful. She brought bread and butter which was to die for!! ( found out later you can purchase) we order 3 appetizers, chicken sliders, there were 4, came with all the side fixing,  Fried calamari, lightly breaded,and wings. Wings were huge! With just enough spice. Servings were huge ended up taking wings home. Definitely going back, just not ordering as much and will buy bread!

Ok so apparently this place is hit or miss. Last month when we came here we dropped about $70. And the service was great and the food was fantastic. I was even so satisfied that I asked to speak to the manager so I can give praise to the server and food. This time, the food was terrible. Fries were dry. Her burger came dry with no condiments. They left the sauce out. My chicken sandwhiches didn&#39;t come with the sauces. Had to ask for them. And then realized they also didn&#39;t give us tomatoes. So I had to ask for that as well. Also when we first got there they seated us in the regular area and I asked for a happy hour menu and they said we would have to move to order from that menu. Unsure why they didn&#39;t ask if we wanted to sit in the bar. Literally the whole thing was a hot mess. The server was great. She offered for the manager to come by. Talked to her. Pretty sure it was the same manager I spoke to last time to leave a glowing review and she literally could have cared less. It was a pretty condescending conversation. No apology. She made a sad face and that was that.  So I guess I won&#39;t be coming here again.

My daughter and I went here in the mall. It was my first time. We got sat right away after being told to wear a mask during the walk to the table. We ordered our drinks. FYI cocktails do not have any pricing, you&#39;ll see why. So I ordered a coconut mojito and Cajun pasta. My drink was pretty, although some of the mint had black spots. It was barely alcoholic. Much to my surprise it was $13.25...<br>So my pasta comes and for 21.50 I honestly expected more. There was a giant chunk of clumpy pasta, see pictures, that when I told the waiter and the manager they asked if they could remove it for me... or if I wanted more pasta... why would I want more of something that you suck at? The managers excuse was that they make it fresh... I said to leave the clump for my yelp review. I got 2 pieces of cheesecake to go and they were yummy. Overall I wasn&#39;t thrilled. Over priced and not customer service oriented. I won&#39;t return next Portland trip.

My review is based specifically off of our experience. We obviously had a great experience. Excellent service, excellent drinks, and excellent food.<br><br>We started with the egg roll sampler. Delicious! Our least favorite item on the platter was the chicken taquitos. They had a delicious avocado sauce that was sweet. I don&#39;t even like avocados!  I ordered a Mai Tai and my fiancé ordered a dirty martini. She said they have the best blue cheese olives ever. Both drinks were great!<br><br>For dinner I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta. It was spicy and good and a huge portion. The chicken wasn&#39;t dry and had a crispy coating to it. Delicious! The fiancé ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza. Holy cow! It was huge! And of course we got cheesecake to go. That never disappoints! <br><br>Our server, Tess was amazing! Super friendly! When we go back we will specifically ask to sit in her section!

Update to my last review. I was contacted by a manager who apologized for the mistake and acknowledged the lack of staffing. She was very nice and sent me a gift card for the cheesecake. I have now been back twice and the service was great and both my order were correct.

So under the circumstances of this virus and trying to help out restaurants,  going here tonight was a huge mistake.  They didnt include French fries in one order, and their corn succatash tasted as if it was from the day prior and was cold. Very, very Disappointed when I called and spoke with a manager all he could say was sorry we are under staffed and then hung up on me. Do Your Job! No excuses.

I definitely find Cheesecake Factory to be on the expensive side, but I am a sucker for their happy hour. My Friday night movie night has turned into Cheesecake Factory/movie night. They do get busy so it is good to get there before 6, especially on the weekend. The HH prices aren&#39;t bad and they have good food. My favorite things on the menu are the southern fried chicken sliders, the tex mex eggrolls and the greek salad. I like how diverse the menu is, I haven&#39;t encountered any issues during my visits and the cheesecake is AMAZING. It has been a nice addition to Clackamas Town Center.

5 stars for the cheesecake but 3 overall.  The food is tasty enough but the prices are out of control.  <br><br>I ordered a meal, the stuffed mushrooms, and three pieces of cheesecake.  It was 70$.  Then I tipped 10$ to my delivery driver.  <br><br>The stuffed mushrooms - 6 total.  $8.50 for 6 tiny mushrooms.  You guys need Jesus.  <br><br>The cheesecake was phenomenal.  The pineapple upside down cheesecake is always a good choice.  The white chocolate macadamia was good, but really rich.  <br><br>After our last order and the Brussel sprout fiasco, (there were no sprouts it was just their leafy shells - we figured it had to have been a mistake) and now the mushrooms I think we&#39;ll stick to cheesecake only from now on.  <br><br>Their menu is huge - but bigger is not always better.

saddest looking meal i&#39;ve ever had. looks worse than those frozen meals in black contains and red boxes. my salmon was so tiny! the cheesecake factory, are you guys running low on salmon?? lol talk about rationing! <br>so disappointed!!!

Update 1/20/19: After revisiting the Cheesecake Factory I&#39;m increasing my rating to a full 5 stars. Every time that I&#39;ve been back, the service &amp; food has been terrific. I love the Chicken Madeira entree. And how can you go wrong with the Korean Cauliflower, Avocado Wraps, or Fried MAC &amp; Cheese apps! Don&#39;t forget to take a slice of cheesecake home too! It&#39;s the bomb! <br><br>I&#39;m caught between a 3-4 for this rating. The reason I bumped it to a 4 is because I know the restaurant just recently opened and they are still trying to iron out all the kinks. It took way too long for bread &amp; drinks to arrive. The bar was backed up. Our server, Mark, was excellent! Below is a rating on our food items on a 1-5 scale with 5 being the best.<br><br>Chicken Madeira: 4, only because it wasn&#39;t piping hot when it arrived. Seemed like it had sat waiting for other dishes. Asparagus was slightly over cooked too.<br><br>Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo: 5, Rich &amp; Creamy<br><br>Orange Chicken: 5, Delicious!<br><br>Chicken Romano: 3, slightly cold &amp; hardly any sauce <br><br>Thai Coconut Chicken: 3, flavor was good, way too spicy and menu said nothing about &#34;heat&#34; for this dish.<br><br>We will be back, but will likely wait a month until things are running more smoothly.
This is my favorite restaurant. Its consistently delicious no matter what I order. Food is fresh, great service.

My wife and I tried this chain restaurant for the first time and were disappointed overall.<br><br>The ambiance and service was fine - no complaints there.  Despite their huge menu, it was somewhat difficult to find something that sounded truly delicious; most of it was just different variations of chicken and pasta.<br><br>We settled on drinks and an app to start: a pineapple moscow mule, a whiskey smash and the chicken pot stickers.  My whiskey smash was tasty but my wife&#39;s moscow mule was anything but.  I realize that a &#34;pineapple&#34; moscow mule already ins&#39;t traditional, but it wasn&#39;t even served in the normal chilled copper mug that most mule&#39;s are.  Also, the bottom of the glass was warm like it had just come from the dish washer.  The pot stickers were tasty enough and presented well, but the sauce would have been better on the side so each person can get the amount they want.<br><br>My wife finally decided on the shrimp (jambalaya? don&#39;t remember exactly) on their lighter-fare menu, while I got the Chicken Bellagio.  She liked her dish, even if it was a bit spicier than advertised.  When mine arrived, I was immediately surprised by the portion - it was enough for 2-3 people to split!  The presentation and plating was also odd.  The pasta on the bottom was not properly tossed in the sauce.  The chicken was on top of the pasta, which made it harder to cut because then you&#39;re also cutting the noodles.  Then atop the chicken was an arugula salad inside a circle of prosciutto.  The was no dressing on the &#34;salad&#34;, so it was dry arugula.  the prosciutto was extremely difficult to cut and the whole thing was confusing.  I ended up scraping off the prosciutto and most of the arugula, but some of it ended up with the pasta which made for an odd texture.  The actual taste of the chicken and pasta was good, but not amazing.<br><br>I ended up getting a cheesecake to-go, which was really good.<br><br>I&#39;d go back for dessert but the actual meal was underwhelming, overpriced and over-sized.  I&#39;d say Olive Garden has equally or better food at more reasonable prices.

Large menu reads like a road atlas. Many styles to choose from. Keto and vegan friendly. Kid friendly, too. All this under a weird amber glow. Crowded, but got a table in less than 15 minutes. Good selection of house cocktails, wine, beer paired with appetizers, small plates, full dinners, and kids menu. Oh.....and cheesecake. $30 to $50 for a 10&#34;. Wow. Very wallet friendly with a family of 5, including teenagers.<br>Sorry, I was so busy eating, I didn&#39;t notice if they had Wi Fi.

We ordered at 2pm for a 7pm curbside pickup. I had called and confirmed with the afternoon manager the online ordering. The order was accepted but when we arrived they had no order. Pretty frustrating. In the time it took to check all sources the manager could have taken our order to get it taken care of. No offer .  Lots of excuses. Manager went to check one last resource and never came back

07/06/19:  3.0 out of 5 - It was my first time to The Cheesecake Factory (TCF) restaurant in Clackamas/Happy Valley area.  Now the last time I was at any Cheesecake Factory was well over 15 years ago...maybe even 20 years ago in Southern California.<br><br>My Father-in-law wanted to go to TCF with the family.  I just happen to be, in a sense, collateral damage in this decision.<br><br>As a fair warning, don&#39;t expect to be seated right away on a Saturday and with more than 6 individuals in your party.  The host(ess) told us there would be a 50 minute wait, and this was at 8pm.  You&#39;ll get a little buzzer thing that has a very, very short range.  So, don&#39;t go to far...better yet, don&#39;t go sitting outside.<br><br>So come 9:25pm TCF finally sat us because they were waiting for a particular booth to open up, which we stated we would rather have a table to make it easier for the elders.  It was apparent, one of the host(ess) wasn&#39;t listening to our request.  Another host understood our frustration and quickly tried his best to get us into a table.  His actions and level of service alone bumped my review up a star.<br><br>After being resituated to a table that was suitable, it took another 12 minutes for being addressed by our food service person, followed by another 5 minutes for water and bread, and then followed by a few more minutes to get our drinks and dinner order in.<br><br>Food came out, and it was okay.  My Father-in-law and I had the Rib Eye Steak dinner, my wife had the Shrimp Scampi, Mother-in-law had some sort of Chicken with Ribbon pasta, sister-in-law had something... can&#39;t remember what it was, brother-in-law had a pork chop dinner, and the nephew had fish and chips.  <br><br>Later, my Father-in-law wanted us to get desserts.  I shared my Tiramisu, which wasn&#39;t bad.  Kudos to that!  We practically all left close to midnight...not quite how we wanted spend our evening.<br><br>The food, for what you pay for it, was just not up to measure.  It could have and should have been better for TCF and for the price.  <br><br>To be honest, TCF rides on the looks of the establishment, which is nice for most restaurant standards, but, although it is out of the staffs control, the noise level is at an ear ringing decibal...sorry I didn&#39;t order tinnitus with my dinner and dessert.  The food is okay.  The staff was okay with the exception the one host and our food service person.  There&#39;s definitely room for big improvements.<br><br>So, one question I often ask myself is, &#34;Would I go back?&#34;  I suppose some day I may be collateral damage again, but I would prefer not to.<br><br>Don&#39;t take my words for it though.  If you had never tried TCF, then I would end this review with this, try it once and decide for yourself.<br><br>Enjoy!

Always such a great time! pricey but the portions are HUGE and the desserts are always delicious. they have a big menu with every kind of food you can want. great place for the family or date night. i recommend getting their pasta.
I got pick-up and at one point I had my cheese cake slice upside down and somehow it&#39;s still almost like it was just sliced off the cake

Avocado egg rolls, good. Hazelnut crunch cheesecake, really good. If you&#39;re wondering if the $10 slice of cheesecake with a bazillion calories is large enough to split, it is. We split it between two of us and still saved half for the next day. It was rich but delicious and the size made the price tag seem reasonable. <br>We had food delivered, so can&#39;t speak to service, but did appreciate the complimentary assorted breads that were sent with our order of an appetizer and dessert. The eggrolls were also presented in the container really nicely, I think replicating how they would have been served in the restaurant, which was a nice touch. <br>When COVID is no longer a concern someday, I look forward to visiting this restaurant in person. I can tell they put care into our small order, so I would imagine dining in person to be at least as, if not more, enjoyable.

We came here after i finally got paid from my new job. My wifr is starting a diet so what better place to over endulge before it starts. <br><br>We got here and were seated right away. We got their signature strawberry lemonade (very good) and then they took our order. I got the bbq burger with sweet potato fries and she got the herb crusted salmon with mashed potatoes. We then got our complimentary bread. That was pretty good too.<br><br>When our food came out i really wanted hers lol. Don&#39;t get me wrong my burger was amazing. I would highly recommend it. My order came out with the wrong fries and it took them until i was almost done with my burger until i got my sweet potato fries. Once i got The sweet potato fries they were overdone and tasted funky. I only ate 1. I waited all that time for nothing. Pretty disappointed. <br><br>My wife loved her food and let me try the salmon. It was way better than that burger. <br><br>The service was alright. The fries took a while to come out. I was out of lemonade for quite a while and it took a while to get our cheesecake that we could see just sitting on the shelf.<br><br>Although they were worth the wait. I got the red velvet and she got the strawberry cheesecake.<br><br>All in all good experience. There were a number of issues but easily could be a 5 star with some polishing.

I just came back from this establishment, and I have to say I&#39;m quite impressed. My sister had the Thai salad, I had the Cajun jambalaya pasta, other sister had shrimp bistro and the kids had Mac and cheese. The Thai salad was delicious! Tastes as close as my moms Thai salad just missing the eggs. The jambalaya pasta needed a little more seasoning but other wise pretty good and a good big portion. The Mac and cheese was very good I almost ate all my daughters food before mine came out. I have to add the waitress was wonderful. Overall if I didn&#39;t have a screaming toddler with me it would of been a great time!  Thank you Cheesecake Factory!

Came here for a birthday party of 7. The waitress decided to seat us in a booth where surrounding booths had at most 4-5 people in one booth. We asked for a table, and we were told to ask the front desk. We did. They told us to wait- so we waited at the booth they originally gave us, a different waitress comes by tells us to wait at the front. We go to the front, another waitress comes by and tells us our table is ready. It seemed like a hassle for us just to get a table, nonetheless, we were seated and given water promptly. The waitress gives us bread to start with and then comes back and takes our order timely. <br><br>We waited about 30 minutes for our food without anyone checking on us until near the end, asking if we wanted more bread. <br><br>We finally received our food. I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta. It was very bland and the shrimp to pasta ratio was about 1 shrimp:3 bites of pasta. In total of about 5 shrimps. So if you want some shrimp with a bite, make sure to take 5 bites of pasta before consuming any shrimp or you&#39;ll be left with just pasta.  <br><br>The free &#34;sundae&#34; they had provided was just whip cream with a candle on top- for a fair warning. It&#39;s free though, so I guess you can&#39;t complain about a dish full of whip cream. <br><br>Overall, food was bland, service was subpar but I read reviews prior to coming in and i set the bar a little lower than I usually do. Still giving this place a 3 star for food taste and subpar customer service.

What a terrible visit we had on 2/8/20.  The grill was not working at all so many items from the menu were not available.  <br><br>We ordered the avocado egg rolls which we always order as an appetizer.  They took 25 minutes to arrive and there was something off about them they did not taste nearly as good as they usually do.<br><br>Our meal took 45 minutes to arrive.  I guess they were just having an off day.<br><br>The only thing that was really good that day was the cheesecake which we took to go.

People in the Portland Metro area really seem to hate chains. I don&#39;t. I love them. I&#39;m not sorry. :-) <br><br>I actually really enjoyed my dinner here. The price for my Parmesan crusted chicken was $18.50 which was more than I was hoping to spend, but it was actually delicious and you&#39;re really going to find these same prices all over Portland. Our waitress though, she was amazing. I couldn&#39;t even finish my Diet Coke before she grabbed the  glass to refill it. She consistently checked in with us and was good at what she did. <br><br>The best part is there is something here for everyone. I mean everyone. And to boot, they have like 50 desserts to choose from. <br><br>Two meals, fountain drink, beer, and desert was around $60 with a tip. I&#39;ve paid more for worse food, honestly. Not mad.

I called to order two cheesecakes for a pick up and the hostess asked me to order online. I was in the middle of  running errands and asked if I could just over the phone since it&#39;s still accepted and I had them on the line. The hostess was so hesitant and responded with &#34;I guess.&#34; He said he didn&#39;t want to have to walk back and forth since they don&#39;t take cards over the phone. I told him I was walking in and then he gladly took my order.

Don&#39;t order ribeye steak the worst steak ever it&#39;s 1<br>/2&#34; before  the grille I&#39;ve ordered medium not knowing the cut is so thin when I got it that thing it was a pice of over cooked dry jerky almost of course got a replacement a bit thicker I would say 3/4&#34; medium well not my stile. Can&#39;t say about other meals on the menu but yah don&#39;t get steak

I placed my cheese cake with strawberries order to be picked up today (5-10-20) at 12:30pm, my text that it was ready came at 1:30pm, I waited in line for one hour to pick up my cheese cake at 2:30pm and when I arrived home the strawberry was not in the package. <br>They had ONE person outside handling all the orders, whoever was inside did not package the order correctly, the management failed and I will not give my business to the Cheese Cake Factory ever again.

My boyfriend and I were excited to have a regular date night again after so long and we had a great time. We made reservations through yelp and were alerted when our table was ready for us. Our drinks and appetizers came in just in time and our service was great. Glad to see social distancing measures implemented in this facility. It made us feel more comfortable. Food was amazing too

Super friendly and prompt server. <br>Good food. <br>Big portions. <br>Great dessert. <br><br>I&#39;ve always loved The Cheesecake Factory and I was really happy when they put in this location. <br><br>We came in for dinner and we were very quickly seated. The hostesses at the door weren&#39;t the friendliest but I&#39;ve come to realize that&#39;s kind of the MO of a lot of hostesses in these type of restaurants. She sat us at a little tiny table squished in between 2 larger tables. It&#39;s not the most comfortable place to sit my 6&#39; 4&#34; husband and there&#39;s almost no table space once they serve the small bread basket and butter. We asked to move to one of the tall bar tables that were immediately behind us. <br><br>Once we switched tables we were greeted by the friendliest server I&#39;ve had in a long time, Kellen. Not only was he friendly and pleasant he was very quick to serve our drinks and bring us our bread and appetizers. <br><br>We tried the tortilla soup, which I wasn&#39;t a big fan of and the soft pretzels with cheese, to start. The soft pretzels were amazing! I&#39;d come back just to order those any day! We ordered the chicken littles and the new orleans pasta for our entrees. Both were good and served in big portions. I personally think the mashed potatoes is one of the best things in the dinner menu! So good! <br><br>For dessert we ordered to-go boxes of the key lime cheesecake and the snicker cheesecake. The snicker one was just average but the key lime was top notch!! I&#39;ll be getting that again. <br><br>Overall, our server &amp; key lime cheesecake definitely earned the 5 stars here. Between the hostesses and dinner entrees I&#39;d have rated just a 3 star, at best. CCF is definitely worth a try though and be sure to order those soft pretzels!

If i could give this experience half a star i would. Every other time i have been to this location ive loved my experience. But today was just bad. The pasta noodles were nothing like what i asked for. We waited over an hour for our food. Our drinks didnt get refilled a single time. Overall it sucked. Which sucks because i almost went to olive garden instead. I shouldve. ‍

This was a horrible and overpriced meal.  The brussel sprouts had no flavor or bacon.  The green beans tasted like they were out of a can.  The filling in the potstickers was mystery meat, and the orange chicken and cashew chicken was drenched in grease.  All the food must have MSG given how we feel.  They would have received 1 star, but the Godiva chocolate cheesecake is pretty good.  Don&#39;t waste your money or your health here.

If you have a big group I would definitely not recommend this place. The lady at the check in was a total &#34;b&#34; and had an attitude since the start when we asked how long the weight was. Definitely won&#39;t be returning to this place in the future. This place definitely gets a  for service.

Had the worst experience ever at this cheese cake factory. First we had really bad service trying to order our food inside. We stood there for 10 minutes and no one said a word to us. Just ignored us. And come to find out that the main person that ignored us was the manager. Second we get out take out and everything is burnt. There is barely any bread, there is no silverware or napkins. Bored.

This is a great place. The portion sizes are very large, so expect leftovers. Aside from that, it&#39;s quite yummy. They have plenty of room for a big party, but you can have an intimate setting too. This is probably the best restaurant in the mall. <br><br>They have a really wide variety of things to get, everything from Asian to Itallian, to classic American. You can get just about anything you want to. But make sure you leave room for dessert. They aren&#39;t the Cheesecake factory for nothing. The cheesecake is really very delishious

I want to first off start by saying I do love the Cheesecake Factory, and have enjoyed going there for a good amount of time. The reason I&#39;m giving this restaurant 3 stars is because of their inconsistency. Each time I go the staff is always very friendly and willing to answer any questions and even verify if necessary. Recently whoever the chef was made the food very hit or miss taste wise. I always get the same meal which is the wellness salad and the last time I went they didn&#39;t even bother to cut the broccoli florets. The food has seemed to become less and less good which is disappointing because I have always enjoyed going here. One other thing I don&#39;t quite understand is each time I&#39;ve went the waitresses have said different things about whether or not some of the food I&#39;m getting or my sisters getting is vegan, which is really concerning on our end, because it has made us sad that we can&#39;t really trust what they say when the answer seems to be different each time. Not only this but the most recent time we went they charged us extra for bread to go! It&#39;s not like we got a whole loaf we just wanted a couple slices to go which are supposed to be free throughout the visit. I honestly probably won&#39;t go back very often because of the inconsistency.

Still one star guys.  We showed up and were told a hour wait.  After 45 minutes of waiting I asked how much longer and was told at least an hour and a half.  We left.  All you had to do was take a name and number of people over the phone.  Great customer service!!  I&#39;m not logging in to whatever site you want me to go to, it won&#39;t make a difference as I&#39;ll never go to any cheesecake factory again!  Probably should hire a manager that knows how to manage.

We visited the Cheesecake Factory in Clackamas town center for the first time. Wait was 1 1/2 hours due to covid policies and busy time which is still not bad in my opinion considering there is usually a wait list. Amy was our server and she was awesome! Extremely attentive, she checked on us frequently, and was very kind and professional. Amy was wonderful! Food was decent, cheesecake was lovely
Such as a good time for dinner here! They welcome us with a professional way. Great staffs and good price!<br>I also like the decoration inside. It looks so fancy and special!

Covid concerns<br>Our server was good and our food was also good crab dip dinner salads shrimp jambalaya. However I had to return to my car from outside seating as I forgot my wallet. When I left the outside seating area I noticed a man in a white apron sitting on almost in the trash compactor. When I returned I came in the same way and he was still sitting in filth. I informed our server and we walked over to see the employee he jumped off of the trash compactor and scurried inside. I asked to talk to the manager he was very unprofessional and did not seem concerned as he played it off as it was probably a dishwasher. His lack of concern and lack of appreciativeness for us informing Him   It made us more concerned about the safety of the food coming from this kitchen. I don&#39;t feel any employee should be sitting on the filth you could see on that dumpster from 50 yards away.  He also replied we do not have a break room because of COVID-19 and I stated surely there is a better place to take a break and sitting on almost in a filthy trash compactor then returning to a kitchen where my food is being prepared it may sound paranoid but I will spend the next two weeks wondering whether my food was virus free I would appreciate a response to this concern

Cheesecake factory is reliable, that&#39;s for sure. The food is always great and, of course, the cheesecake. So, the 3 star rating isn&#39;t for the food, it was the service from the kitchen. While our server was attentive and prompt to take our order, it took over 30 minutes to get our dinner. Dessert was much quicker (since everything is in the case), but with so many great restaurants at and around the mall, I wouldn&#39;t recommend this one during the dinner hour unless you&#39;re not immediately hungry.

First of all, we didn&#39;t know there was one here in Clackamas Shopping Center! We thought we&#39;d try it out.  <br><br>This was our first time at this location. D H had the Steak Diane: Medallions of Steak Covered with Black Peppercorns and a Rich Mushroom Wine Sauce. Served with Mashed Potatoes and Grilled Onions.  I had a Cream of Chicken Soup, since this was the only thing I wanted today, our waiter recommend I get the cup &#39;it will be big almost the size of a bowl&#39; and I did.  I asked him, if it came with some crackers or bread, he said he could bring me sourdough, but I don&#39;t like that, but he was gonna bring us bread &amp; butter anyway, so I settle with that. And we split a house salad. <br><br>The food was all wonderful. We had two types of bread, that he said, &#39;just came out of the oven&#39;.  They&#39;re what reminds us about Europe, and the room reminds us of Europe.  No matter where we were in Europe: a simple bread &amp; soft butter always made us dream &amp; wonder everything around us, make for everything so relaxing &amp; pleasant! (or that it was just about my husband and I falling in love all over again? not sure, but . . .the environment in the room, with all the &#39;happy birthdays&#39; going on, we&#39;re feeling good vibes around us)!  Note:  The chicken was so tender, I thought I was eating salmon!<br><br>BTW: our handsome American/Asian host told us the wait will be 15 mins. but we ate @ the bar side.  I&#39;ve figured only the handsome people get to work as host! AND college students!<br><br>Our server was exceptionally good, came back for each dish to ask us how our foods were. We had a take out Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cheesecake, we had that for lunch the following day! My 10 months old grandson got to enjoy a few tiny bites, too.  YUMMY!<br><br>I like the idea of more bathrooms here, nice &amp; clean, toilets flushes as soon as you get up (unlike the last restaurant we went to in Vancouver), and much much better!

Trendy. Inconsistent. Solid wait staff. Our group had a Caesar Salad, chicken teriyaki, nacho, and fettuccine. $18.50 for a salad, what the heck. My buddy could not finish his chicken because of bad taste and texture. The Nacho was decent. The fettuccine was simple, to simple for the price. We went here because my buddy liked the chicken he had last time. The host, servers, and support staff were excellent. I won&#39;t go back for the food. To many other great places. I would go back for the service though.

I&#39;ve been to multiple Cheesecake Factory locations and this particular location is by far the WORSE.<br>My girlfriend and I have been to this location multiple times for different occasions and they have failed to win us back over and over again. <br>One occasion, food came out cold and burnt. (They flipped the salmon upside so it wouldn&#39;t reveal the burnt side.) <br>Another occasion was for a birthday (party of 5), the food took 1hr, our waters were never since the beginning of our visit, the list goes on. <br>They&#39;re unprofessional, SLOW, not consistent. <br>Not worth the money at all.

It&#39;s hard to believe that a chain restaurant could have such amazing food whether you&#39;re coming for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or dessert, but somehow The Cheesecake Factory manages it. Their menu is a cazillion pages long. So far, I haven&#39;t tried something I don&#39;t like!<br><br>My favorite cheesecake was made with peanut butter. And as I ate my piece of cake, I felt so sad for all of the Europeans who don&#39;t get to experience peanut butter like we do in the US! <br><br>Their breakfast burrito is so so good. It&#39;s expensive (all their food is expensive) but it&#39;s so darn delicious and filling!

I went in with my friend for a late lunch &#39;James&#39; our server was absolutely a delight, he is a very nice man, attentive, clear and knowledgeable about the menu.<br>Definitely will be going back for the Carne Asada.<br>And the banana cheesecake it was perfect.

Our 1st time here was great! The ambiance is great! Kellen, our server was on point and friendly. Dinner (tuna poke and mushroom burger)was good and the cheesecake (fresh strawberry &amp; dulche de leche)were sooo good!<br><br>Will cone back.

Came only for happy hour on National Cheesecake Day. Not sure if all days are busy like this place definitely needs more staff, waiters that is. The greeter was confused and we waited for a while for the food, check, and waters. Anyways the key takeaways for the food was that the crab dip was the only thing worth getting. The rest are average. The complimentary bread was good. The calimari and chicken tenders which are on the regular menu was good for my taste.

We picked up food on 8/24/2020 while we were at the mall. Surprise! The calamari was the best we&#39;ve ever tasted and the other food was delish as well (salmon, Thai lettuce cups, Cobb salad). The food here is so good that it&#39;s well worth the drive from WA even when you&#39;re not going to the mall. Highest recommendation.

Cheesecake Factory has its own unique appeal. Epic sized portions, the smell of butter fogging up your eyes and lots of menu options.  Stopped by for a late lunch, was seated promptly with very gracious staff.  The order consisted of happy hour items, avocado spring rolls, fried shrimp, tuna tartar, burger sliders, bistro shrimp pasta and burgers.  Sounds like a lot and it was  the flavors were familiar for this franchise. Fried items with dense strong flavors of oil butter and cheese. The dipping sauces were amazing.  Fries weren&#39;t fresh, a bit stale.  Tuna tar tar didn&#39;t have much flavor and Pasta dishes were good but could have been better is pasta was cooked al dente.  The bistro shrimp would have been better with sautéed shrimp instead of fried. The server at our table was truly amazing. She was courteous and attended requests very quickly.  5 stars  for her! she delivered a birthday sundae which was a nice touch. Overall a very pleasant dining experience.   The food is good but don&#39;t compare it to an authentic Italian restaurant or artisanal burger joint. It&#39;s a bit sad because all the ingredients are there, just needs the culinary expertise to level up.  The cheesecake of course steals the show, always decadent.  I think if you have a large group there&#39;s a ton of options to satisfy everyone.<br><br>To the manager who replied. On the contrary we were impressed by the service and the food was excellent. I was only citing comparisons to pasta and fried items prepared to a crispy texture.  Other than that y&#39;all nailed it

The service here (at the bar)  wasn&#39;t very good and the kitchen didn&#39;t put any silver in my to go dessert order. WTF, am I supposed to eat cheasecake with my hands?<br><br>Once I closed my tab, I was invisible to the bartenders and couldn&#39;t even get their attention to ask for some to go silver.<br><br>While dining alone,  I still tend to have a large tab and tip very generously. I guess the staff here don&#39;t care.

Updated review.<br>So this time just my husband and I went and we were seated immediately. The server was extremely attentive and on point so that was very nice. The food itself is good. Feel like everything is very consistent but it isn&#39;t a wow factor. If you&#39;re looking for a good meal at a reasonable price this is definitely a reliable place to go. I had a crispy chicken and shrimp, it was supposed to be a sweet and fiery sauce, but there was only sweet and it overwhelmed every bit of the dish. If the sweet was more subtle was and and some real heat added I think the vegetables would&#39;ve had a chance to stand out. Since it is shrimp and chicken they were cooked separately and then combined in the dish. My shrimp itself was cooked perfectly but the frying was uneven and doughy raw in parts. The chicken was bland and unseasoned.<br>My husband had the chicken enchiladas,  It is a pretty dish to look at, the beans still had some meat to them so they were good did you want, the rice is left really crispy almost like they re-Fried before they serve it which is surprisingly good. The enchilada sauce appear to be taken and have a good consistency but again the sweetness over took it. I&#39;ve never had a sweet red sauce, the enchiladas have corn and that only adds to highlight the sweetness.<br><br>Original:<br>I wish I could post some glowing review with photos but we were given a 3  hour wait for our group of 10 on a Thursday night. Cheesecake Factory will not accept reservations. We sent someone in an hour early to hold our spot and 1/2 way through our 3 hour wait we changed our request from 10 folks to 8 and the manager told us it makes no difference because this location is smaller than Washington square and only has 3 &#34;larger&#34; tables. Parties of 2 are the ideal customer for this locational they were being told only a 20 minute wait. Cheesecake Factory will not combine along 3 small tables for 2 in order to create a space for 8.

First off, food was amazing! Our server Kelly took care of us and explained everything in detail. Even when some food came out differently than intended he didn&#39;t miss a beat to correct it and make us feel as if the mistake never happened. We will be back not just for the delicious food but the phenomenal service to servers like Kelly. Great job!!

The service was fast, friendly and thorough, and the food was well prepared. My bf and I used to go to the Waikiki location often when we lived there, when we moved to San Diego we were disappointed and haven&#39;t gone back to cheesecake factory in awhile. But the Happy valley location did not disappoint!
Great variety of cheesecakes. Never wait long for service. Huge menu of variety of choices.

Daniel, the bartender, was quite literally the best bartender I&#39;ve ever had in my life. My lady and I came in late night, last night (02/18/2020), and the service was impeccable. Being in the industry myself, I tend to scrutinize even the smallest of mishaps, never report them just notice them during my personal experience. My man, Dan, was simply on point. Great recommendations, he recommended drinks, an app, an entree, and a dessert and we bought every single one, and they were all on point. Thanks Dan, we&#39;ll be back!

This place is awful!!! Only 4 pieces of shrimp when your paying how much!! And barely any sauce! Do not go here. We did take out and they even went way passed the time even when i ordered it 3 hours before.
Great food and convenient location. This is a family favorite restaurant. The service has always been top notch. The food is excellent.

I was told to wait for 1hr 15 for a party of 9. It was past that time and waited a total of 2hrs because the host said that another party was still using the table and were still talking. She said half of the party was still seating their and talking. People were getting seated before us and never was I asked if we could get accommodate differently. The Cheesecake Factory should start doing reservations to accommodate families.

I&#39;ve been going to The Cheesecake Factory for years and this time I chose it as my $100 tip night during my week of giving. I only do this if the service is good and it was great!  We had Melissa T, who I&#39;ve had before and she always rocks it!  Fast, polite and with a smile!  Food was awesome. I stick with the chicken picatta. She also recommended the banana cheesecake which was amazing!  Keep up the good work Melissa and I hope you pay it forward!

We are from out of town and stumbled upon this location. It was our Anniversary and we had an amazing dinner here. It was super busy but the service was great and the food was beyond delicious ! I had chicken costoletta and hubby had chicken bellagio . Our cheesecake was the best we had ever eaten.

I ordered delivery tonight through door dash and the delivery people were very nice!  I ordered the Chinese chicken salad.  The first salad to arrive was only lettuce, rice noodles and dressing.  I contacted door dash and they reordered for me.  The second delivery had all of the vegs and crunchiest, but once again no chicken.  I don&#39;t know if the restaurant is out of chicken or they are letting me know I should be a vegetarian.  Either way very disappointed!!

This review is strictly for the Cheesecake! <br><br>Discovered that I could place the order online and have it ready for me when I waked in. That is awesome because the worse thing about Cheesecake Factory is waiting for your order to be ready. <br><br>The website was easy to navigate and there was an option to pay at the store so I didn&#39;t have to enter my CC info online. Great options, fantastic Cheesecake, and always friendly service.
Worst place ever, food is fine costumer service is horrible. Rude people who don&#39;t care about the guest dining

Bad service. Waited over an hour to get a table, than about another 45 minutes for a tiny soggy pizza &amp; burger that was so sloppy... He ate half the burger &amp; was done. I had returned the pizza &amp; was only charged for the 15$ burger.. Place is a joke &amp; waste of time.

Honestly, based on all of the BAD reviews that I read upon coming... I didn&#39;t expect a whole lot. My standards weren&#39;t very high. Also, I thought the food probably wasn&#39;t going to be that great because it&#39;s a restaurant chain. Usually, I try to stay away from big food chains because the quality or flavor isn&#39;t usually that great. To my dismay, I was quite happily surprised. <br><br>My boyfriend&#39;s parents got us gift cards to this place so we wanted to put it to good use. When we first walked in, it took a few mins to get greeted by anyone. But it didn&#39;t take long for us to be acknowledged and seated right away. It wasn&#39;t very busy. The servers are friendly and provide great service. Everyone we encountered were very prompt and attentive. We appreciated that very much. The ambiance is delightful. Romantic, dim lighting, and the noise wasn&#39;t too loud. <br><br>I always do my research before going anywhere new. I checked out the menu to see if they had offered Vegan options. They literally have a MENU BOOK! Lots &amp; lots to choose from. It was a little overwhelming at first. <br><br>They have something for everyone whether you&#39;re vegan, gluten intolerant, pescatarian, love your steak, chicken, pork, etc. Everything sounded delicious! It was hard to choose, but we managed to narrow it down to the Avocado Egg rolls, Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta, and the Diane steak &amp; Crusted Herb Salmon Combo. We were blown away by how good tasty everything was. We finished our plates lol.  The flavors were on point! The food came out at a very timely manner as well. Huge plus! Can&#39;t wait to go back!

Today Mother&#39;s Day was not a good experience Cheesecake Factory I had it confirmed 12:30 p.m. pickup for a cheesecake at 1:30 I was text cheesecake is ready I&#39;m waiting in line to pick up the cheesecake  its 1:50 not good

So unhappy!  First, we waited two hours.  We were told 1 to 1 1/2.  Okay, I get that.  Can&#39;t push people out the door..  but we were told multiple times that there were two people in front of us or that a table was being cleaned for us..  anyway, finally got seated.<br><br>Ordered drinks, then ordered food.  Waited about 10 minutes while noticing that the table next to ours (seated AFTER us) was eating bread..  from previous visits to other locations, we knew we normally got bread.  Had to ask the server then she explained it was baking.  Okay, we&#39;ll wait...<br><br>Got our food..  husband ordered steak tacos without cilantro.  Menu said they came with tomatoes, avocado, rice and crispy onions.  His had only steak and some crispy onions, some marinated onions.  The rice that was served with it was green (cilantro rice, not mentioned in the menu).  To top it all off, everyone&#39;s food was cold, especially my husband&#39;s!<br><br>Asked for a manager and when he finally got to our table several minutes later, he was apologetic and explained that what actually comes on the tacos is PICO DE GALLO and GUACAMOLE, both of which have cilantro in them.  He also told us about the CILANTRO rice.  He did get a new meal made for my husband, but it took at least another 20 minutes to get it, after the rest of the table was completely finished.  AND.. the fries were cold!<br><br>I get that this place just recently opened.  Obviously lots of kinks to work out.  But we ended up being there, between waiting to get seated, waiting for our cold food (first round) and cold food again, it was close to four hours and almost 11 pm!  Manager did not come back to check on my husband&#39;s replacement meal.  He did comp my husband food, but nothing else.  I feel like we should have at least been offered dessert!   We won&#39;t be back for quite awhile!
Great service, large portion sizes and very tasty food. Their menu is literally endless and I always have so many options to choose from. Order from their lunch sized pasta specials!

Waited for about an hour until we were seated and ordered. First thing I noticed was dirty silverware...good thing I had two other spoons and a spare fork. Our waiter James offered delicious warm bread and butter. He was very nice and checked on us/filled our beverages very frequently. <br><br>Before we got our food, we were brought 3 plates and two serving spoons that obviously weren&#39;t washed very well... one of the plates had a grubby handprint on the top from grabbing it, and the other two were still greasy. One of the spoons had something stuck on it.<br><br>We ordered the shepherds pie and the smokehouse bbq burger. They were both very satisfying. :-) <br><br>Long story short, the food was good. I still need to try the cheesecake. I don&#39;t enjoy eating off of dirty plates, its flat out gross... maybe they need to hire a more thorough dishwasher?? Lol

The service I receive here has always been consistently good. The servers really seem to know the menu which can be overwhelming - and while it&#39;s overwhelming it is fun trying new things and never getting bored with options. Ive never had a bad dish here and always look forward to returning.

So happy that this location opened up as it us much closer than the Beaverton one. <br><br>We went here for dinner yesterday and the food was amazing as usual. The menu is like the Torah but that&#39;s a good thing because everything on it is AWESOME. You can get pretty much whatever you&#39;re in the mood for.<br><br>The only downside is going to be my bank account after how many times I come here.

We went in with a group of 8 and they told us it would be a 1 1/2hour wait and that they would seat us together by putting 2 tables together. After 2 hours, we finally get seated. That&#39;s was ok , we agreed to the time. When we get to our table, they would only allow 5 of us maximum to stay at one table and the other 3 had to stay at a separate table about 10 feet away.  COVID rules they say. We couldn&#39;t even communicate with one another, which the whole point of us going out was to hang out with our family and friends. At the end, when we got our bill, they charged all of us gratuity because we were a group of 8. How are we a group of 8 if we are separated seating at completely different tables across the walkway??  Needless to say this will be our last time going to this place, as it defeats the purpose of why people go out... to actually enjoy a nice dinner with friends and family and have a great conversation. Good luck to you guys.

I was in August of this year. My friend and I went there about a hour before they closed. The waiting time is about 20-30 minutes for dine in. We thought that reasonable and a lot of people wait for tables during that time. We got our table about half hour before they closed. We didn&#39;t get our complimentary bread. The bread is one of the reason we went there. When we sat down they still have the bread serve the table close us. The waiter didn&#39;t tell us they were out of bread until we got our meal and I asked him. We ordered one appetizer and one pasta. We didn&#39;t get share plates until we were half way eating the pasta in small appetizer plates. I got hot water with lemon to drink but the water and the cup both were dirty. He already helped me change two times, but the water still have something inside.  Everything getting worse compared to our past experiences, hopefully it will change back.

Was able to sit down right away at the bar. The drink I had - Georgia Peach was very cool but I do think almost $12.00 is a little expensive for what you get. The salad I had was very good and the portion size was a good size for lunch. I would definitely eat there again!

Dear management and head chefs. I&#39;ve LOVE the HH menu, had eat so many places but still love the food here.  2 weeks ago I&#39;d when there w/my son for HH was sitting in the bar area for a really long time, there&#39;s 2 server standing talking look at us and walk away. BAD services. Today we both still have to wait for server. PLEASE make its better with the services. OMG... I&#39;ve always tell my friends my coworkers how&#39;s wonderful your HH menu and food. Today as I always order my FAV. Chicken sliders and the Chicken nugget which I loved. The Chicken sliders and nuggets thin as a cracker. PLEASE change back to the way it&#39;s was, the Chicken thick and juicy.

Went. In with 2 others and had a to go order, total bill $94, was charged five cents for a bag that was too small to hold the take out food, tacky, tacky.  Went to Cinnabon after lunch for takeout dessert and was given a free bag for the food, classy store, will revisit Cinnabon , not the other place

Ordered two entrees and it took thirty minutes for our food to come out. I ordered the bistro shrimp pasta and my boyfriend ordered the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. Mine was so plain I was really disappointed because it had all my favorites in it- mushrooms, shrimps, and greens. <br><br>To help the flavor I added a bunch of salt and stole some of my boyfriend&#39;s pasta sauce and mixed it in mine. The &#34;sauce&#34; from my pasta tasted like really watered down, something.. can&#39;t really describe it cause there was no flavor/seasoning! I told my waitress that it was bland and I had to use another dish&#39;s sauce and she shrugged it off and laughed.<br><br>Two stars cause the spicy chicken chipotle pasta was so full of flavor, it helped give my pasta some flavor too and the service was decent but I wouldn&#39;t expect tooooo much from this place.

Sunday night, we arrived as a party of four adults and three kids (ages 4, 3, and 7 mos.) at 6:30.  Hostess says wait time is 40-50 minutes.  No biggie.  We caught up with some friends in the lobby for five minutes.  Regretfully, 40-50 minutes eventually was not the case.  Fifty minutes came and went. Still not a big deal.  By the time 7:45 came around, my kids sadly started complaining about being hungry and thirsty.  They had been so great at this point. I said to them, &#34;I know it&#39;s been an hour and 15 minutes. You&#39;ve been so good.&#34; That didn&#39;t even faze the manager on duty who overheard me say this to my starving kids. By 8:06, it seemed the restaurant had emptied by the time we were seated.  At this point, our friends had already eaten and went home.  A 96-minute wait for a relatively small party to be seated.  Well done Cheesecake Factory. Glad you cared.<br><br>*Updated 1/22/19 in response to the comment from the restaurant: The condescension in your reply was not helpful at all.  I sincerely hope that was not scripted by corporate.  Your patrons will come when they come. It is not always planned.

Truly an amazing staff! From door to door was a great time for me and the family. I was my first time there and my Portland family goes once a month. <br><br>The menu is impressive and almost too much to choose from. The food items are described well and i had so many things I wanted to try...but the fried mac n cheese burger got me and I was super happy with my choice. With a food allergy I have to be careful and ask questions and they went back to ask the cooks. A manager even came out to confirm the burger was OK and insured me I was going to have a safe meal and that was the extra mile they went for me. <br><br>All our food was great and the smells of food around us was intoxicating. Only regret was that we were full and did not get cheesecake and a cheesecake factory??? Guess we should have taken some home, our loss :-( I will go back as I have many future choices to try and next time cheesecake will be on my plate at the end of the meal.

I am giving three stars based upon my previous experiences with the Cheesecake Factory.  Their food is generally very good.  Portion sizes are pretty big, on this particular occasion I was hoping for the beet and goat cheese salad.  With the grilled artichoke as my second option.....  much to my dismay they didn&#39;t have any beets which also eliminated two other dishes I was considering and the artichoke was out of season (can fault them for that).  However when you have at least three menu options that include beets you should<br>Make sure that you have them on hand.  Their menu is extensive but in Jan I like most others are watching calories or at least making healthier choices when possible, so their fried options which were aplenty just weren&#39;t on my list of &#34;can eat&#34;.  This is a new restaurant to the area but a chain where these things should all be ironed out already.

Came here with family a few weeks ago and we all enjoyed it lunch meals. I got the veggie burger and was pleased with how filling it was! My partner got the appetizer Korean cauliflower bites and we both loved how crispy and spicy they were! Other members got steak which they seemed to enjoy and even took the potatoes home for left overs and another got the cashew chicken with brown rice which looked great as well. Wish we weren&#39;t so full and had gotten a slice of cake!! All of the desert bar looked delicious!!
Food was great and kinda pricey but good food great service I had a great time I even got a beer for a reasonable price it&#39;s awesome

The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is like an ENCYCLOPEDIA of things to eat.  Because their menu has such an enormous number of items, it&#39;s fun to try different things whenever I go there.  Tonight, I was in the mood for dinner with a lot of variety so I decided to just get three separate items from the &#34;Small Plates &amp; Snacks&#34; section of their menu.  I ordered Stuffed Mushrooms, Chicken Taquitos, and Cheeseburger Spring Rolls. . .which were all quite different from each other.  They all came out of the kitchen in a timely manner and I admired their &#34;presentation&#34; as they sat next to each other on my table. . .then I dug in.  I&#39;ve had stuffed mushrooms at many other restaurants before and these were on a par with most others, well prepared and tasty.  The chicken taquitos were OK too.  The Cheeseburger Spring Rolls were unique, kind of like Chinese Egg Rolls filled with hamburger, cheese, and grill onions.  Well, all three items were pretty good and definitely &#34;satisfying&#34;, although they were all a little bit greasy.  However, I&#39;m not going to hold a little bit of greasiness against them.  I figure that&#39;s just the nature of these types of &#34;finger foods&#34;.  In fact, I&#39;d probably go back and order these same three things together again some other time.  They go well together.

Opened around Christmas, this place is happening. It&#39;s the hottest spot in Clack-E-mas-Land. Go for the Vibe, the Service, the Portions OMG! More Cheesecake?<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is an excellent addition for Clackamas Mall.  The Cheesecake crew is numerous, it&#39;s moves fast.<br><br>Endless menus...  there are actually 250 dishes for you to choose from.<br><br>I&#39;ve never seen so many people ordering up cheesecake in my life! Which one should I have? That IS the question...<br><br>After your food? ... you can have a mall experience!<br><br>Tip: This place is busy, plan your arrival time, if you don&#39;t wanna wait.

I used to love the Cheesecake Factory! Now I will explain why I gave them a 2 star rating . There food is ok- I went there last time and the food was so bland ! I waited 2 hours to be seated , no problem cuz my choice - but I was so sad to get such a small ( super small ) portion on my plate for such a huge price ! My expectations if this place went way down . <br>Now there deserts are a different story ! Still super delicious!

Dinner is such a wonderful moment of the day and to sweeten this moment, was the time of happy hour!  My destination was actually set to Laurelhurst Market as I&#39;ve always wanted to try their famous steaks but traffic on I-205 North really got jammed and honestly I didn&#39;t want to be a part of that anymore and decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m not really sure that I understand why the restaurant has some nasty reviews as I have never had a bad experience at this location or the one at Washington Square mall. I ordered the warm crab dip and the Steak Diane with Shrimp scampi and really enjoyed my meal. The service is always good with delivering hot food made to order and great ambiance for a nice casual meal or bringing a date. Lots of menu items to choose from and all reasonably priced. The restaurant can always make special accommodations within reason to suit your needs. Always a great place to go to for a large corporate restaurant. Definitely one of my top 3 places to go to.<br><br>Crab Dip with toasted baguette -$6.50<br><br>Steak Diane with Shrimp Scampi- $22.95
Mmmm! Great caesar salad, garlicky goodness! Split a chicken avocado BLT with fries and that was great too.  Service was friendly and fast. I&#39;m a fan@

I have gone here for dinner multiple times and each time keep Giving them another chance because when the food and service is right this place could be my favorite place. But time and time again they have disappointed. I don&#39;t even know why I kept giving them another chance.<br>All the staff seems lazy and not attentive to their guests. From taking 10 minutes to bring water , to gathering all the staff to sing anniversary songs in the kitchen during business hours. They can&#39;t even get the bread right and have it actually warm and toasted. I always get the $25 salmon and shrimp scampi, the last time I went it took 30 minutes for the food to come out and once it finally did the food was extremely burnt and they put the burnt side down on the plate so you couldn&#39;t tell. It sucks because Cheesecake Factory has so much potential but it just seems like staffs minds / actions are elsewhere when they&#39;re are at work. They have multiple employees walking around but no one is getting helped at least not in a timely manner or with quality in ANY WAY. Cheesecake Factory is supposed to be a nice/decent place to eat. I got better service at Dave and buster across the street. Not worth the money to get crappy service and crappy food , where I can&#39;t even relax because I have to complain / send my food back / etc. if you want to pay some money for a crappy experience go here! ;)

It was our zillionth time at Cheesecake Factory this afternoon. It was a Sunday, so it was crowded all day. We had the Meatball with spaghetti and Chickwn Riesling. Both were delicious.<br><br>Food = outstanding = Meatball with spaghetti and Chickwn Riesling.<br>Seating area = clean<br>Service = excellent <br>Restroom = clean<br>Parking = plenty<br><br>.

First time at this location. Long wait for big party. Which is to be expected. Great food, great service. So many options and varieties. Cheesecake was heavenly. Lemon raspberry mmmmmm. Order chicken and biscuits for dinner very good

I really enjoyed eating here. We had the greatest service, and the food was very tasty. Great bread basket,I also ordered a burger, it was juicy.  The carrot cake was perfection also. I would love to visit again and try so different deserts.

The food is so fresh at The Cheesecake Factory. My understanding is that everything is made fresh daily. Also, they try to have as little waste as possible. My favorite item is the fried chicken sliders. Soooo good.

The service is slow and the food isn&#39;t hot after taking 45 minutes. The bread is cold and stale. The bang bang chicken and shrimp was very underwhelming, the chicken had a chalky texture and the sauce was very sweet especially considering the dish was supposed to be spicy. The shrimp was the only good part of the dish. <br><br>The menu is way too big with almost 20 pages to the menu, good luck picking something. <br><br>The cheese cake is good but the regular food seems like a joke. Also a mai tai is 12 bucks and menu doesn&#39;t have prices on it.

Server was GREAT! But the food was just down right awful and for being that expensive is why I&#39;m making a bad review. Second time trying this place and it still was bad. Got the stuffed cheese burger with grilled onions and I swear there was ONE onion on it. My boyfriend then got the bbq burger and the bun was bigger than the meat party haha also both of our fries came out cold and we had to wait an abnormal amount of time for everything to come out. Just kinda sucked all together :/

Very happy with everything I ordered. The cheddar stuffed burger reminded me of the juicy Lucy burgers in Minnesota. They were a bit messy to eat but really good.  The j.W. Pink lemonade is a great cocktail to have if you are looking for a good fruity drink.  I also ordered some chocolate mousse cheesecake for dessert because you can&#39;t go to a Cheesecake Factory and not get cheesecake. I was too full to eat it so I&#39;m saving it for tomorrow. I wouldn&#39;t recommend coming here on a Friday night unless you want to wait 40 minutes because it&#39;s packed.

The food was pretty good. Consistency did very a little from other Cheesecake Factories have been to. Especially with the gluten-free shepherd&#39;s pie. I definitely enjoy that better at other locations. Service was very slow but polite. After a long wait for dessert they did do a great job wishing happy birthday to my son.

This place is great. Sometimes a little wait but it&#39;s because it is good. The employees are great. The food is so good.  The waitress cat was very helpful with All her customers.  There breakfast on the weekends is great.

I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in almost 10 years. When they finally opens a location closer to me, I decided to go check it out. I forgot how amazing their food is! Good portions and so full of flavor. I love their pasta dishes! They also have some pretty delicious alcoholic beverages as well! Their food menu is full of variety, broken down in to sections; chicken, steak, pork, vegan options, specials. Will definitely be back again!

Restaurant is in the shopping mall but you can avoid the mall scene if you want by just entering the nearest side entrance to the mall. Beautiful decor provides an escape from the ordinary. We like to go mid-day, when it is quiet and relaxed. Large menu, and it is possible to get a healthy (low fat) meal here! If you&#39;re just looking for liquid refreshments, they have a very nice bar. We&#39;ve experienced accomodating, friendly service throughout each visit.

Two hour wait for bland food. Skip it! <br>I had gift cards for this place and want it to try it out. The person in charge of seating said it would take 40 mins. I kept seeing people arrive and be seated within 20 mins, and every time I checked on the time she would say I was the next on like for a table of 4. Again people would get seated and even larger groups. After I asked to speak with the manager &#34;surprisingly&#34; there was an open table. The food was bland, nothing special. The food I buy at the hospital where I work has more seasoning.

Place has great salmon and my favorite mashed potatoes from any restaurant. Add on top of the the red velvet cheesecake and its a perfect meal. The staff was friendly when i went and the wait was long but they cant control when they are busy so cant ding them on that.

Been here a few times since it&#39;s opened. Every time the floors are filthy. There is silverware and trash everywhere and the servers see it but don&#39;t bother to pick it up. I&#39;ve never had much of a wait time for a table but I can see how it could take awhile. The food is very underwhelming... not good enough for the price. I felt like I could have made it at home. We also ordered dessert and our slices tasted crusty on the outside- like they had been sitting out all day. The server was accommodating to my sisters severe nut allergy and said the kitchen was sanitizing stuff (who knows if that&#39;s true). The service is blah but with the prices I feel like it should be held at a higher standard. <br><br>Trust me, you can find a better place to eat around this area.

We tried to make reservations for a Saturday evening as there would be 11 of us. We were told they don&#39;t take reservations, so we had someone arrive at 5:30pm with hopes of being sat around 6:15pm.  We finally got a table a little after 7:30pm.  We all ordered sodas or drinks from the bar, my friend and I also ordered a couple appetizers at this time.  Nobody else was ever asked if they wanted any starters.  Our appetizers came out before the sodas and other drinks... the main portion of the meal was ok... my friend and I used the restroom after dinner and at this point the server asked if anyone wanted dessert, a few people ordered cheesecake to go...when my friend and I got back to the table we were given our checks, at that point I asked the server if I could get a slice of cheesecake to go as well.  He said of course and I gave him my payment, when he came back with credit card slip he said sorry I forgot your cheesecake, do you want me to go get it now or do you want to go up to the front and get it? I told him to forget about it because everyone else was ready to go at that point... by the time we all left it was 9:30pm...In my opinion I feel like a 2 hour wait time for a table is ridiculous!<br><br>**edit: it seems that all of the responses from management are very cut and paste, not sure that they&#39;ve actually addressed any issues
Staff was super friendly and there patio area is awesome (for better lighting). Took my wife here in her birthday and went swell. Kudos to the staff for arranging her a birthday cheesecake.

An hour wait to get in...though I&#39;m not sure why I even thought coming here was a good idea. I&#39;m just going to get right down to it. The only thing the Cheesecake Factory has going for it are the cheesecakes, nothing more! This is a shit show restaurant that fails in every regard when it comes to food preparation. Let&#39;s begin with the frozen entrees that are reheated -over cooked and burnt. I went with the eggplant parmesan...the flavor your ask, well it&#39;s a mix between licking a charcoal briquet and chewing on bark, void of any flavor! Meanwhile, you pay $18 for it...which really boils down to how much dogs shit can you eat. The crab bites, so I thought anyway, were equally over cooked and tough to stomach and just when you think they can&#39;t screw up your cocktail drinks, guess again! Also, the margarita pizza, holy shit...you get 8 pounds of dough and everything clumped in the center with chucks of mozzarella that seemingly slide right off and take everything go with it, haha seriously?!?  STICK TO CHEESECAKES! <br><br>The service was the thorn in my side, our waitress was horrible, rude and inattentive. When asked for cheese to be grated on my dish, she had a look of being pissed that you&#39;d even ask such a thing. <br><br>Bottomline, this location is a FAIL...it offers nothing for its patrons except for a big bill and possibly a gut ache! If I had to do it again, I would have opted for Claim Jumper across the way.

Let me start off by saying that I NEVER leave negative experience reviews. However, after what my boyfriend and I experienced at this location, I felt like it was absolutely necessary. <br><br>We were initially told it was going to be a 45-60 min wait until we were sedated. (Totally fine, we have no problem waiting for decent food and good service) <br><br>We were eventually seated and our waitress Katlyn kindly greeted us and explained it may take longer than usual to get our food due to being so busy. My boyfriend ordered the herb crusted salmon and I ordered a BLT sandwich. <br><br>After waiting about 45 minutes to receive our food, it was HORRIBLE. My fries were cold and had become soggy by the time they reached our table. The bread on my sandwich was so stale I felt like I was going to damage my teeth while eating it. My boyfriend (who had never been to any cheesecake factory before) Salmon was dowsed in lemon and was so potent he couldn&#39;t even eat it. Our waitress asked us how our food was and we explained the quality issues. She kindly apologized and asked if we wanted something else instead. We have NEVER sent food back prior to this and it was extremely disheartening. <br><br>At that point we asked for the check so we could go somewhere else to eat since it was 9:30 pm by then. The manager ended up coming to our table and asked about the issues with the food. My boyfriend explained to him how the salmon was too strong and acidic and the manager looks at him and word for word says, &#34;Well then you&#39;ve never had good salmon before&#34; I was horrified. We have dined at some of Portlands most upscale restaurants where he only orders Salmon. Now mind you this is a chain restaurant so our expectations were not nearly as high. After arguing with us about how wonderful he thought the food was, I told him we would pay for it all and we needed the check immediately. <br><br>Our waitress Caitlyn brought our check and only charged us for the beer my boyfriend had at dinner. We tipped her $30 on the bill, because in NO way was any of this her fault. So thank you again Caitlyn for the wonderful service and I hope the manager doesn&#39;t treat his staff as poorly as he treats his customers. <br><br>The Washington Square location is so much better and I have never had a bad experience there. If you want poor quality food, a ignorant manager in your face and a starving stomach by the end of the night then the Cheesecake Factory at Clackamas is your place. We will not be returning.

I&#39;ve been here many times with a party of two and even a big party of 10, and never really had an issue. The downside is they don&#39;t accept reservations and they need majority of your party to be there if you guys would like a table right away. Honestly, the wait is not that bad either on busy nights. It is definitely pricey, but every time I come here I enjoy the food &amp; the service is always great. The menu is so big so it&#39;s hard to know what you want if it&#39;s your first time here but there will definteky be something you will enjoy.

The Cheesecake Factory offers the best cheesecake options in portland! The dining atmosphere Is suited for  both casual dining and romantic nights out. The staff were very friendly, and knew their steps of service very well! The entrees were defiantly delicious and definitely left us satisfied!

This is my first time here...and probably my last. I tried to order the Seared Tuna Tataki Salad. The one they have on the Skinnilicious menu AND the regular menu. Nope. What? The waitress says they haven&#39;t had it since they opened this location. Ummm, okay, but shouldn&#39;t it be blocked out or have some indication that it&#39;s not available? Fine. How about the French salad on the menu? Two minutes later, nope, we&#39;re out. At this point, I expect a manager to come out and apologize or a comp for the inconvenience. Nope. All right, do you have the Greek salad? Yes. FINALLY. You have the appetizer sized salad. Which ended up being just OK.<br><br>Our waitress was nice and polite, but personally, I would have let a manager know about the 2 orders for the table that were a no go and/or offered a dessert or something when I was clearly annoyed that they didn&#39;t have my first two options available.
Cheesecake factory is exactly what you would expect. The kids absolutely loved it, we went for dessert after a fun night out for our sons birthday.

HORRIBLE FOOD!!<br>Stay away from the food just stick with the cocktails and cheesecake you&#39;ll be Ok<br>Maybe a salad on a good day but that&#39;s it !!<br>To Bad one location can be so different than the other there just winging it over there in Clackamas Sad!!

Their happy hour is so good! Half off some appetizers. Get the avocado egg roll and fried Mac and cheese balls, they are the best! We&#39;ve been here for dinner as well and their pastas are really good. After dinner we decided to grab a cheesecake to go, TOOK 45 MIN FOR A SLICE OF CHEESECAKE TOGO.

Had lunch here with a friend. We have been waiting for this place to open for months.  Food was fantastic and service was great. Great lunch specials that have huge portions. Great menu, something for everyone. Definitely gonna be regulars here!
22$ for 3 small pieces of steak and 3 shrimps, the silverware was not clean and food overpriced for the that low of the quality; also 4$ bucks for a cup of soda?

Had brunch there on 12/23.  Very disappointed - with all the wonderful places in Portland we had decided to try this place.   Food very average to below.   Not only that but at 10 am the bathroom had no soap in dispensers.... how does the waitress staff wash their hands when emptyContacted cheesecake with concern but never responded.   Sad<br>-Chris
