i will never go to this cheesecake factory again nor would i recommend anyone to go.  i was out doing food deliveries tonight when i got one for this location. a $130. order mind you.  upon arrival staff were extremely unorganized and not helpful!!  all&#39;s they kept telling me is its not scheduled for pickup yet!!  yes!!  i understand!!  listen!!  it&#39;s been marked as ready for pickup!!!   it had been marked as ready about 12 minutes prior to my arrival!!  sometime later a while later they then proceed to tell me the order had been put outside on the table for deliveries and someone must have taken it!!!  okay well what are you going to do about this situation?!?  still very unorganized!!  i called through the app to speak to a customer service agent.  they assured me that said situation was fixed with the cheesecake factory and the order was being remade as we spoke!!!  fantastic!!! i then call the customer and apologize and give customer a heads up on the situation!!  customer was very understanding and humbled by my call.  a while passes approximately 25-30 minutes i asked another employee what we were looking at as a time frame on getting the customer her order?!?   still very unorganized, rude, put out that i&#39;m asking about the order again!!  they then tell me the customer has to contact support that the cheesecake factory can&#39;t do anything!!!   are you kidding me?!?   you knew i&#39;ve been out here.  you knew the order was stolen by someone and you don&#39;t believe in customer service?!?   i was at the cheesecake factory over an hour waiting to get a customer&#39;s order that was stolen and you want to be rude, unprofessional, and act put to me and also to your was going to be paying customer?!?!?   that&#39;s how you do business?!?   not only was one manager rude and unprofessional they both were.   the female manager was rude as f to the was going to be paying customer!!!   i&#39;m disgusted that your business operates in such a terrible manner and even more so during these times!!!  .it&#39;s not the customer&#39;s fault then food was stolen off your unsupervised table!!  anybody can walk to that table and steal to go orders!!!   we are in times of you need business and should be 110% about customer service!!!  you need business but guess what!!   i don&#39;t need your business!!!  shameful!!!!!
Best server ever, five stars to Niranjan. Perfect suggestion and warm service. Food was exceptional, specially the grilled steak medallions and Godiva chocolate cheesecake.

So happy about this location opening up! I had the honor of being invited to pre-opening night &amp; it was such a great experience amazing food as I wouldn&#39;t expect anything else from Cheesecake along with the outstanding service.

Highly disappointed in the management staff at this location. What was supposed to be a lovely lunch with an out-of-town friend. Ended quite awkwardly when I was informed that I needed to move tables because a larger party needed to be seated.

2+ hour wait just to be seated.  Food was ok.  Worth the crazy high prices?  Not a chance.  Although our server was a pleasant fella, the service in general was average.  Nothing about our experience validated the prices that we paid.  Unsure if we&#39;ll go back.

Very mixed experiences. First time had a great server and the last time we were there we had a server that clearly didn&#39;t care. Never know if it&#39;s been a bad day for them though. Very good food and huge portions. Love the drink and cheesecake options.
As always, did not disappoint.... Clean, fast seating, good service, tasty meal, and worlds best Dulce de Leche cheesecake!!

We took our grandchildren for brunch and although the service was ok the kids waffles had that had sat under the heat lamb so long their plates were too hot to touch and you could not cut the waffle. <br>My ricotta pancakes were excellent. <br>Maybe it is a conscious CORP decision not to be kid friendly but crayons and a kids menu you can draw on would be nice.

Just a few weeks ago me and my mom went here for my birthday. I had gone recently with my husband and really liked it so I took my mom for lunch. I ordered Miso Salmon and that took 45 minutes, then it came out completely raw. Then that took another 30 minutes and at that point my 1 year old was crazy fussy and just done with lunch. I want to add as well that the table across from us order 2 plates of miso salmon, and so did the table behind us. And they got their food about 10 minutes after I told them mine was raw. Our server barely ever checked on us, and it took forever for her to ask us if we wanted boxes or our check. They didn&#39;t comp my meal at all, I barely ate it after sipping on soup for so long. I understand accidents happen but they didn&#39;t seem concerned.

I&#39;ve been here twice and my experience has been the same during both. Food is wonderful. The Tex Mex egg rolls are great and their fries and dipping sauce are unreal. But the service frankly sucks. Servers take forever to check on you, when they do they seem ditzy and unable to help... it&#39;s just kind of a subpar place to eat. I see multiple reviews where people make the same complaint and management replies without even an idea that they&#39;ll fix it. They just say &#34;sorry about that&#34;, with no offer to follow up. Wonder if they have so many complaints it&#39;s unrealistic to follow up on them all.

I live the cheese cake factory but this one sick ass!!! Worst service ever.y husband orders a burger and the party was dry to the max. The bun was all burnt. I ordered a shrimp with angle hair and my shrimps where all soggy and the flavor is just very different then the one at Washington sq. This place just sucks.

Not sure how you could go wrong with all the options here! Everything that was brought to our table was delicious. Plenty of gluten free options! If you&#39;re lucky you&#39;ll get Jaylynn for your server, she was amazing &amp; absolutely made our night.

Our server was cool and helpful, but the food just wasn&#39;t as good as I&#39;d expected it to be. We had the Mac and cheese balls and they were okay, but bland. Not really my thing. We also tried the avacado rolls. They were good, if you like avocados. I don&#39;t, so I didn&#39;t enjoy them much.
Always a fun place to take the family. Christy made our daughter Morgan&#39;s Birthday special.<br><br>We&#39;ll be back in a month for Kenzie&#39;s Birthday in April.

This is not my first time at cheesecake factory but I can say I always have a great time here. The service was really good the food was really good and we went there right at 12 PM so there was a minimum amount of wait. The only thing I wish that cheesecake factory would do is lower their prices. The food is absolutely amazing but the prices are a bit too high. Me and my girlfriend Went around lunchtime and we got one appetizer, two entrées, and one soda and with tip it ended up costing us $60. Which is a little expensive specially for a college student like me. But overall I really enjoyed the food and I&#39;ll be see the cheesecake is the best part.

Of course like the many others I don&#39;t even want to give you even one star because you don&#39;t deserve it!!!  Puke !!  <br><br>I go in there to get a cheesecake and I come out with Anything but a cheesecake!!  Scamie effin marketing !!  unbelievable bullshit !!  well I can&#39;t eat the damn cake because I needed a &#34;cheese&#34; cake!!   And it&#39;s not a cheesecake it&#39;s a CAKE!!   it&#39;s a layered wheat cake inside with fake frosting all through it and on top of it .... it&#39;s enough to make me throw up!!   ‍ of all places I go to a cheesecake factory for a cheesecake and I come home with a wheat cake if that&#39;s what I wanted I would&#39;ve went to a damn bakery not to the Cheesecake Factory!!!!  <br> No kidding !!  I&#39;m completely done with your restaurant and any other restaurant who pulls the same shit!!  People are sick and tired of eating food that makes them sick and EFFIN tired !!!  Stop lying with your marketing and your help should tell the people that it&#39;s not a cheesecake....  it is a cake!!!  Very very stupid for a restaurant that&#39;s called the &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; to be selling anything other than cheesecake!   Bye-bye now!!i<br><br>And I&#39;ve been reading all your responses to your unhappy customers !!   .  you ought to be ashamed of yourself !!  ALL you are doing is blowing them off and you&#39;re not changing a damn thing in your restaurant and you should be offering at least something to some of these people and you don&#39;t... you just blow them off with your fake niceties it&#39;s just more bullshit and another reason for me to never darken the doorway of this restaurant again!  Seems I&#39;m not alone!!

My servers name was Alex. He was super fast, kept checking the table to make sure everything was good, my drink was NEVER empty. Was there at 3:45ish. I ordered the Louisiana pasta and red velvet cheesecake, passion fruit mojoto and an amazing margarita! Alex is cute and great! I want him as a server again!

So today 3/22/2019 went in to eat for my gfs bday me and her stayed there for about 45-60 minutes had a good time had a couple drinks after we ate and when we got home she had forgot her wallet on the table we was sitting at. Called and asked if her wallet was still there it was and everything was in it including $350 cash. So thankful there is actually still good people in the world. To the person or employee who turned it in god bless you.
It is unbearably loud. The music needs to be turned way down. Servers can&#39;t hear you. The loud music makes everyone talk louder amplifying the problem. I am out to eat not at a night club!
Nice place to come with friends and hang. Lots of fun and good food, nice service, place with nice memories.

Ahi Tartare was actually amazing. I would love just a big plate of that. Wife had Zuccinni fried (needs flavor) And I ate Gumbo. Also really good. Service was fine. Took a bit to get the cheesecake we ordered though.  Thats why a 4 n not 5 star

Ordered the cheesecake factory on DoorDash app. Total came to $40 for a kids meal mini burgers (no cheese, no ketchup, no nothing!) Bread and meat, 2 items, about $10. I then got myself a salad and come to find that it had 3 big chunks of tomatoes and less than half of an avocado in slices. I felt impelled to remove the items to chop them up myself and I put them back in the salad. Also for the size of the salad, they gave me a pitiful amount of ranch dressing. I got one tiny little side of ranch dressing for this large salad so I was only able to eat about %40 of it. The rest was dry salad. The potato soup that I used to love, had no potatoes in it. Just creamy potato broth and pieces of carrots. ‍ I was pleased to find their delicious bread in my order, but NO butter.<br>Just felt like some simple no brainer items to include in the to-go bag. Butter for the bread, cheese and ketchup for the kids burgers and extra side of ranch for my salad, would have made this meal a lot better. <br>I would absolutely love a refund.

Went here for dinner with my family. There were seven of us. It was a Sunday around 7pm. We waited only about 10 minutes to be seated. Once seated the service was slow. Long wait times to order, get our drinks, appetizers and entrees. At least 20 minutes between each. It took 20 minutes to get two cocktails two beers and two sodas. Plus we had to ask for water, glasses that were never refilled the entire time we were there. Food was okay although I was very disappointed with mine. I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta. I was looking forward to the extra spicy Cajun sauce and was sad to see none. It was a pile of pasta that was dry and stuck together like it had been sitting in the bowl and got cold. There were maybe five pieces each of chicken and shrimp that were good and seasoned with the Cajun seasoning but there was no sauce insight. When I order pasta I assume that sauce will come with the pasta especially when the description says in spicy Cajun sauce. the server was very accommodating even offering to give me another dish or to get me more sauce but the fact is I had waited over 45 minutes to get this meal and I didn&#39;t want to wait any longer to eat. the best part of our meal was the dessert the Godiva chocolate cheesecake was very delicious and to be honest I would only go to this restaurant for the cheesecake because the food at least the dish I had wasn&#39;t worth it and I don&#39;t like to wait almost an hour for my entree. If I had been with just my husband we would have left already but we were with family from out of town and they chose the restaurant.<br>We&#39;ve been to the Seattle restaurant and loved it, who knows we may try this one again if only for the dessert.

On a Saturday night it was about a 20 minute wait. Our waiter Harold was amazing. <br>We had the egg roll sampler (which was delicious) and we got the mac n cheese burger and the chicken parmigiana &#34;like a pizza&#34;. Both dishes were much bigger than we expected, and were sooo good. With a mixed drink, appetizer and 2 entrees our bill was $64. Usually when it&#39;s that high I&#39;ll complain that restaurant was not worth it, but this time-- totally worth it! Good place for date night. High recommend, will be back.

What a disappointment this was. The food was barely average. I had a chicken &amp; avocado club sandwich. One small piece of chicken on Each half. Had to order fries separately.  My friend ordered a turkey club plus bacon. No bacon on the sandwich, the server made no attempt to fix the error. The server, Daniel, was not personable at all. The place was not full  so some more attentiveness on his part would have been greatly appreciated. I doubt seriously if I&#39;ll go back to the cheesecake factory, there are a lot of other restaurants around the Portland area they give much better service and better food  than this.

The food is good but the service is terrible. We waited 1 hour and 45 minutes for our group to be seated only to be served by a waitress who was obviously in a bad mood. I seriously have no clue why any of the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s don&#39;t take reservations. Anyways our kid was at the table with us and at one point the waitress sort of shoved my kid to get the food onto the table. She served our food and was gone the whole time, never came by to offer refills or ask if we wanted anything else. In the end we ended up asking for our checks and left. Don&#39;t know if we&#39;ll come back to this location again.
Worst customer service. It took 25 mins to get 3 slices of cheese cake to-go on a Sunday night at 9 pm. Never again!!!

We love this place, it&#39;s the quality food we&#39;ve come to expect from Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s nice to know that even cross country they&#39;ve maintained standards so well. I highly recommend the Mac and cheese burger- it&#39;s amazing!
Great food, awesome cheesecake  good service! Very nice inside but kinda spendy so be prepared. But the cheesecake is yummmmmmmm!

The atmosphere is good, though busy.  Ordered Crispy Pineapple and shrimp with white rice.  Way too much sauce and rice was crispy, meaning either old rice or reheated.  Either way not good.  My dad had the pork chops which were bright pink inside, not cooked fully, and mashed potatoes were lumpy.  Will not go here again.

DON&#39;T WASTE YOUR MONEY! We were so excited for Cheesecake Factory to open in Oregon because we enjoyed CF in Calif. and AZ when we traveled. We are sad to report that after 8-10 visits, most of the time; we leave disappointed with the service. <br>Wait staff are distracted and elusive. One time the excuse was that he was meeting with the manager; my guests and I along with many other patrons in our section were sitting unattended for FOURTY MINUTES. Patrons were walking around to search for servers. The waiter said that he was sorry and that his co-workers were supposed to take care of his tables while he was meeting with his manager.  <br>Tonight our server spent the night breezing by and avoiding eye contact with us as much as she coul. After we had been there an hour and a half (it was not busy; there were plenty of open tables) we had to get up from our table and interrupt her path to flag her down. She returned to our table smelling like cigarette smoke. We did not get bread (this was not the first time.) They ran out of turkey so one of my guests had to select a different entree. They often run out of ingredients, so when you select the perfect entree from the menu, I recommend that you have a back up plan because if you have ask for the menu again; you will have to re-wait for the elusive wait staff to re-appear, this will add at least 20 minutes onto your dining experience. <br>One night we did get AMAZING waiter. If we could get him every time, we would return because we love the menu, but sadly one awesome guy can&#39;t carry this place. Shelling out nearly $20 for a plate of pasta, is worth it in So Cal and AZ but in Oregon we have poor service on top of over priced apps and drinks. meh This chain is an epic fail in Oregon.

Crab cakes were a little over cooked, Crispy and DARK brown on the outside, but the Pineapple Moscow mule I ordered was Amazing. Service was good with our first server only to be switched but our second server turned out to be better! I ordered the shrimp and sausage pasta, also amazing. I got the smaller Lunch special size witch was plenty of food after I ate the bread and an appetizer. Overall I was happy with my dining experience at the Clackamas Cheesecake Factory. I would recommend eating here. One thing... you&#39;ll have a wait to get seated with a larger party but worth it.

I had never been to this new Cheesecake Factory before and my husband and I wanted to go on a nice date. We got there and were seated. They provide you with great tasting bread that keeps coming and amazing service. I definitely enjoyed my server. My husband and I both got the &#34;Four Cheese Pasta,&#34; definitely an amazing choice I would recommend. The Oreo Cheesecake was also a delightful choice though I was too full to finish it all. You really get your moneys worth here and excellent service. I will be coming back!

We have tried this location 3 times and we will not be spending our time or money here again. <br>1st visit, while newly open, we ate at the bar and ordered a few appetizers. The buffalo wings and the egg roll sampler plate.  Not hard to make and should arrive in 10-15 min.  Well, it took almost 40 minutes for the food to arrive and when it did it was cold, not warm but cold.  We asked the waitress to have them redo the buffalo wings.  that&#39;s exactly what they did. They put the already cooked wings back into the fryer and cooked them again.  <br>Needless to say they were not Edible at all.<br><br>The second visit wasn&#39;t too bad it seemed like the restaurant was getting better with their service and food. Couple minor hiccups in our orders but nothing to really gripe about. The order of fish and chips were decent.<br><br>The third visit was quite the opposite. It took over 25 minutes for someone to bring us water, And the waitress wasn&#39;t even ours.  Our waitress came by with in 5 min of us being seated and said she would be right back. Never saw her again.  We were finally able to order and when the food came it was not even presentable.  My wife ordered the soft tocos an we could not eat them. It was like someone missed several of the toppings and the steak was hard as rocks....like they used beef jerky.  Didn&#39;t have time to get anything else seeing how we just spent 1.5 hours sitting there with our empty glasses.  <br><br>Not returning!

OK I was totally excited that the Clackamas area cheesecake factory was coming and I was totally counting down the days since I love the cheesecake factory and I was upset that the one cheesecake factory that I know is all the way over at the Beaverton Mall so I am glad that they came into the Clackamas Town center, because their food and their cheesecake is the bomb and anyone who knows or has ate there knows that their bread especially the brown bread (sorry I don&#39;t know what it&#39;s called) but that bread is delicious I mean just the bread alone I could make it a meal. <br>Now everyone knows that the cheesecake factory has the most delicious cheesecake and desserts hands-down the food is actually very good and the portions are mighty big so if you&#39;re just an average size eater you will definitely take home half your meal but if you&#39;re a big eater like my son the whole dish is no problem! So as for the food I seriously love their food! And the menu selection is a 10! <br>but my reason for the minus one star is a incident that happened I believe several times now if this happened one time that would be OK but it happened twice and I did contact the manager about it and if things change on my next trip I will update this to 5 stars and I think that is what yelp is meant for! For us to do the social media thing and for the owners to see the negative reviews  written about their business and to actually reply if they can but at least the next time when you do go in cuz the food is good or the many other services went great, you should go back again but mention that you had a bad experience last time and that you let social media know but willing to change the negative to positive with a  hopefully blessings things changed. <br>you can always go back and change your review but really come on I mean if you think about all the negative compared to all the positive it&#39;s sad because people only read and base their will to<br>Visit or not based on the negatives! <br>you can have a business that has 1000 customers and only three customers who write a negative and bring that business down to a one star business even though it&#39;s a great business because the 997 other happy customers are still going! <br>But my docking of one star is due to their curb side service! I call in my order which is such confusion at times, and twice now they don&#39;t come out forever! Then you gotta call again to remind them your there! Also several times I open the bag and there are no utensils or the condiments you asked for! <br>One time my order was mixed up and the request I made not done.  So I called and asked for the manager, he was so nice and apologetic and even offered a free gift card but I said no need. So he said he will work on making sure orders do not get forgotten to come out and that all request are now more closely looked at and the silverware is always in the bags. <br><br>Next time I go I shall surely see if there is change and if so then I would love to give them a five star! <br>But I am glad that they finally came to the Clackamas side! And being a franchise of course food is always the same taste, cost is same and size of food is same. The inside set up is the same and nice and clean but just need to remember us disabled peeps like me that ask for to go orders for curb side! <br><br>Thanks Suzy-Q is our!

If not for good service I would of given the place a 2 Star. Food is not nearly as good as the other Cheesecake Factory. And to find a way between levels at the mall is annoying. To top it off some high class person keyed my trailer, I think they were upset I require two parking places when towing. They say keep Portland weird but I say you can keep Portland and the surrounding area.
Fantastic desserts and good service but the music was sooooo loud we had to shout to visit and still could hardly hear each other.

The food is amazing. Took my mother to dinner there with to announce we are expecting twins. And it was a great special moment. Then to sweeten the deal someone paid our mean in full anonymously or it was comped either way we have no idea why but it was a pleasant surprise and amazing dinner. My steak was cooked so perfect didn&#39;t need steak sauce. Perfect in every way.

This was our first time at any Cheesecake Factory Restaurant. We had a gift card and went for lunch, and I&#39;ll admit that I didn&#39;t have very high hopes since we eat mostly plant-based. They actually had several options to choose from, and we settled on the vegan club salad. It was really good and very large. I would plan on splitting it next time. We also ordered a fried cauliflower appetizer but they didn&#39;t bring it until after the salads. This wasn&#39;t a big deal to us at all and we said nothing, but the waitress and then manager came over and apologized repeatedly and then comped it! I was shocked. I would go back just for the customer service. That&#39;s unheard of these days.
Me and my man are regulars here and we always have the best experience here. I LOVE EVERYTHING HERE! THE FOOD, THE CHEESECAKES!! 6 stars

Who knew that the Cheesecake Factory opened in the perimeter of the Clackamas mall? We stumbled across this place and have enjoyed eating there several times. We have been eating at Cheesecake Factory restaurants throughout the country starting with the original Beverly Hills location few decades ago. The experience and food are the best that you can get at a corporate kitchen and sit at the enclosed patio. You won&#39;t be disappointed

Terrible service, terrible management. Waited for water, the dressings for a long time, my relative had almost barely any chicken on her salad she ordered, the manager said no to my request of slightly changing the price of an item that I ordered without(!) the shrimp and looked at me like I&#39;m totally out of alignment; well I have worked in restaurants for over 15 years and I&#39;ve never had any manager ever say no to a customer. Ever. If I could give zero stars I would..

The food at this location is very inconsistent. <br><br>Today we ordered a Factory Burrito Grande to go without chicken and cilantro. The burrito was filled with white sticky rice and was inedible. We ordered the same same burrito twice before in the last few weeks and was fine.<br><br>We called to complain. The first reaction I got was whether we ordered the burrito at Taco Bell, since the burrito is not on the menu. Then the manager came on the line and told us that the recipe changed in the last 6 months. Then the story changed that the rice was over cooked. <br><br>We know what white sticky rice looks like, and don&#39;t like to be lied to. There was no accountability. They did compensate us for the burrito, but the lies and behavior will result in us not coming back for awhile. It&#39;s too bad, we love the Washington Square location and were really excited they finally opened up in Clackamas.

If I could give this place no stars, I would. <br>We went last night for my sisters birthday. We had a larger group (10 adults and one child), so we called ahead earlier in the week but they do not accept reservations. <br>We arrived an hour early to get our name in before everyone showed up, and they told us it would be a TWO HOUR wait. That&#39;s ridiculous, but it was my sister&#39;s birthday, so we decided to wait it out. The time went by, and long story short, 2.5 hours later we left without even sitting down. There was another large party eating and they were loitering after their meal was done. For a LONG time. The management did nothing to remedy the situation. After waiting that long, nothing. They didn&#39;t ask the other group to not loiter. They didn&#39;t offer to seat us anywhere else or split our group (at that point we probably would have just done this!) or anything. We all left completely enraged and starving. Horrible experience. Their lack of customer service was disheartening and I don&#39;t believe any of us will ever be back. Twelve thumbs down!!!

Do yourself a favor and just drive to the Wash Square location, this place was terrible. Food was the worst that I&#39;ve ever tasted and I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory many times at Washington square and others out of state. On top of it, I passed along feedback to manager and he could care less.

The food was good. There was food and napkins under the table as well as crumbs on my seat I had to wipe off before sitting down. So the restaurant wasn&#39;t properly cleaned. The service wasn&#39;t great but I&#39;ve had worse.

Last night was good until the mgr Logan started criticizing an associate on the floor in front of her customers making her feel uncomfortable for her and us we didn&#39;t need to hear that there is a time and place for that and that wasn&#39;t the time are waitress was really nice and polite not sure what the manager problem was LOGAN food was good service was good this was only are second bad experience since it&#39;s been open

Waited 40 minutes to be seated and then a meal for two took 2 hours. As I write this review I&#39;m watching my cheesecake sit on the counter where it has sat for 10 minutes while people walk by, look at it, and breath on it. The worst service I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant. The famous food and cheesecake doesn&#39;t make up for the absolutely horrible and long service. Will not come back here.
This is a really nice place. It&#39;s new and inviting if you  are in town. The cheese cake is amazing with every king of variety to choose from.
Excellent service and excellent food. Steak, chicken, pizza, chips, lemonades, all done perfect!! Will be going again!
A huge wait poor service and bad food. <br>This place is nothing like Washington square. Stay away.

Been here multiple times first time was great wait staff has been great every time. Now I have to get to the negatives. Long weekend wait time had called ahead for my father in laws birthday was told 15 min wait took a hour to get seated and wait time for food was even longer. Next children and crying babies DO NOT belong in the bar area. The last thing I want on an adult date night is to be seated next to a couple with a crying baby. To make it worse despite specifying everything needed to be Gluten Free for celiac disease we where still glutened. Nothing puts a damper on date night like being sick and having a dermatitis heretiformis breakout.

Had a great experience on my grandsons 4th birthday. No wait time, fast service the food was awesome! Strawberry lemonade was so refreshing on a hot day. Our waiter was attentive &amp; did an amazing job relating to grandson. He felt so special when the crew sang happy birthday to him. Love this restaurant!
Ordered on Grubhub. Order came stone cold, burger was literally burnt and had a thick layer of salt on top, didn&#39;t come as described. Hardly worth the expensive prices.

I have to say it&#39;s one of the worst meals my wife and I have had. She ordered a pasta dish that sat under warning light way to long. The sauce was burnt, noodles dried out, and oil puddled at the bottom of the bowl. I ordered the grilled chicken/avocado/ bacon  sandwich. They brushed it with oil/butter and soaked the bottom layer of bread. It was a big greasy mess. It was bad. Not worth the wait time or money.

I&#39;m not a chain person but wow, the food is great here! They can be disorganized but it&#39;s such a huge place. I hate when I have to wait but we try to go off peak hours. Shepherds pie and the pastas with breaded chicken are my favorite.
Delicious food. Great place to go out and they even deliver now on grubhub and other delivery apps. The food is filling and tastes amazing. I recommend it!

Food was great but not worth the wait. If you have nothing to do with your day you can spend it waiting for your food and drink. The waitress was very nice and apologetic. The manager came over and apologized too but it didn&#39;t change the pace of the service. Checked in at 6:40, sat at 7:50 didn&#39;t get out meal until 8:40. We knew it would be busy so we had selected our meals while we were waiting. Ordered desserts to go and added an additional wait.
Had the worst service. Server monica came and took my order. Always good tell I waited 15 to 20 minutes. No drink water no customer service. Got up and left table 11 Sunday

Tried this restaurant last Saturday <br>Got right in and help was bountiful <br><br>We ordered appetizers and they were good<br>Husband got Shepherds Pie and I ordered lemon chicken <br>I got 3 pieces of chicken and not all 3 pieces were completely done (yuck)<br>We never were offered refills on our very expensive ice teas<br>But, we would go here again as they are brand new and I am sure this was just a one time mistake plus I really did not need 3 pieces of chicken anyway<br>Did not get dessert this trip

Not impressed tonight. Once seated it took them about 15 to 20 minutes just to be greeted and to get water order. We chose to order food at this time. It was busy and the waitress apologized and guaranteed she was going to take good care of us the rest of the night. 50 minutes later a new server came to us and said the other server was going home and he was taking over and our food was on the way.  I was ready to cancel the rest of the order and as I was talking to the new server they brought out the food, which was cold, and felt like it sat under the lamps for 20 minutes. Oh the last 20 minutes we watched the original server basically twiddle their thumbs back and forth and no acknowledgment to us at all.  Not impressed tonight as we thought a drink, some dinner and cheesecake would be a good anniversary dinner....not at all. The only reason I am giving 2 stars is the fact that the second server was kind and tried to be pleasant.

The Springs at Clackamas Woods usually has a restaurant outing once a month to give the residents a chance to try different venues and cuisine.  This evening there were two groups of diners with two servers, but we were seated at tables pushed together so we could sit in close proximity. <br><br>Our server, Tessie, distributed the menus and took our drink orders, which were served in a timely manner.  After placing our dinner orders, we were told that the kitchen was out of some of the items that were ordered so some of us placed a different order. When the server took our orders she was very systematic in writing them down but when we were served there was an issue with the items ordered for each guest. <br>Our dinners had ample servings and all of us agreed that they were tasty.  <br><br>The problem occurred with the billings.  Each guest had an individual bill but the line items on each bill did not agree with the diner&#39;s order.  There were so many mistakes on 12 of the bills that the server returned several times to clarify what each diner ordered.  The Springs representative asked to speak with the on site manager, Damon Johnston, who responded with the statement that he didn&#39;t know what the issue was and it would take additional time to address this problem.<br>At this point it had already been 30 minutes after dessert was served and there were still billing issues.  <br><br>As we were leaving, the server was thanked and, under her breath, was heard to say she hoped our group never returned!  This was so unprofessional and uncalled for.  It turned a pleasant outing into one that left a bad taste in our resident&#39;s mouths.  We are very disappointed in the attitude of the management staff and will be contacting your corporate office to express our displeasure.<br><br>Mark J Taylor
I honestly didn&#39;t like the Cheesecake Factory the food was not good and the service was so bad they were arrogant and mean! I would not recommend this place!

So......my father of 74 wanted to surprise our whole family by reserving a table at THE NEWLY OPEN CHEEEESE-CAAAAKE-FACTORYYYY YEEEEY!!!!!<br><br>He got there on time 5:15 and got his mechanism and we all got there before 6, knowing that the table will be ready at 6:15/6:30... 6::51pm The mechanism buzzes and the lights go party!!!! We go in and to our surprise they have a table for 4 people instead of 14!!! The music is so loud that they don&#39;t understand people with little accent! My dad has an accent and I&#39;m sure they couldn&#39;t hear him clearly but they didn&#39;t mind lowering the MUSIC A LITTLE LOWER!!!!  SOME PEOPLE HAVE LOWER VOICES, SOME (yes!) HAVE ACCENTS!!!!!!<br>But that&#39;s not a complaint. The complaint is the managers attitude and unprofessional approach to the situation.. we are not trash we are humans that deserves respect!! So when you tell us to go home after two hours show some remorse show that you care!! <br>EVEN CHICK-FIL-A SHOWED MORE RESPECT FOR BEING 5 MIN LATE!!!!!!!!!! <br>&#34;Here s 10% off for next time&#34; or &#34;free slice of cake for next time&#34; etc..<br>I think the managers name was Mr. Damon. Congratulations on your upgrade from Burger King to cheesecake factory!
Pretty standard as Cheesecake Factories go. Enormous menu, relaxed contemporary environment, and good people. Enjoy.

We were a group of 7 and were sat pretty quickly at our table, large portion (we had lots to take home) and everyone liked their food! There were a few mistakes on our orders though. Things like the way the meat was cooked, and what kind of shrimp. That&#39;s why I was going to take a few stars off. However our server, Lloyd, was great! I&#39;m a vegan so dining out can be complicated and he was extremely helpful! He went out of his way to personally check that the chefs didn&#39;t add any animal products like butter. So he&#39;s the reason I added and extra star! Thanks Lloyd!

Cheesecake Factory restaurants are typically one of my favorite places to eat, but this is the worst one I have been to. First, they were out of a couple select steaks which we specifically went to Cheesecake Factory for. Then, when someone in my party gets their beer the beer glass has a broken rim which cuts his lip. After telling the hostess about this it still took over 10 minutes for the manager or waiter to come to our table. The manager apologized and offered to take care of the meal. When the meals finally showed up, our friend with the cut lip&#39;s meal didn&#39;t arrive with the rest because they forgot to make his mashed potatoes. He got a salad in the mean time and finally got his meal after about 10 more minutes, but it was cold and still without mashed potatoes. At the end, our friend gets the bill for his meal which included his salad and a drink beside the one with the cut glass. It took calling the manager over, then the manager arguing with our friend before the issue was settled. In the end our friend got his cold meal and drinks compensated, but the entire process was a nightmare. We will not be returning to this specific Cheesecake Factory ever again.

Do not go here if you want a good nachos!! Burned my first serving after waiting a half hour and sent it back waited another half hour and came back the same! First time I&#39;ve ever been and the last. Horrible nachos! Just awful

We love going to the Washington square location. They always give realistic time expectations and food is always great. I know the Clackamas location is fairly new...but I&#39;ve not been impressed...We ordered two pasta dishes over the phone. Went to pick it up 25 minutes later as the person taking our order suggested this timeframe. The girls in the to-go area told my boyfriend they were just waiting on the pasta. Pasta is literally all that was ordered. After my boyfriend had been waiting AN HOUR AFTER THE ORDER WAS PLACED, he checked in again and they said they were still waiting on the kids marinara pasta plate...they FINALLY gave him our order an hour and 15 minutes after the order was placed..this is the kids pasta dish that took them an hour and 15 minutes to make..

If you&#39;re looking for a really good dessert or cheesecake this place can&#39;t be beat. As for dinner here it was just so meh. And for the price there are plenty more amazing restaurants to go to in Portland imo but I do love a good cheesecake lol

I LOVE THIS PLACE. Love the service, and the food was not ridiculously expensive, our total price came out to be as average considering the amounts of plates we ordered, and the atmosphere is very nice. Sometimes it gets really busy and the parking lot gets really crowded. Also there could be a long list of the waiting line
The celebration cake was so good we went back two days in a row we can&#39;t get enough of it. would love to come back every day for the celebration. Can  I marry the cake, is that legal in Oregon?

Went on a Thursday afternoon around 3pm. Friendly and fast. The enivorment was chill it was just me and my boyfriend. I loved that we had a one and one booth very cute. We had the stuffed mushrooms and fried mac and cheese for appetizers. They were both yummy and hot. I had the Steak Diane &amp; Salmon and My boyfriend had the Lasagna. It was delicious. Oh goodness definitely coming back. Also our server was nice.

This truly is a Factory. Step on the conveyor belt and ride through the machine. Edible food served by adequately trained staff. Airport quality cocktails. A churn and burn chain from the 90s that has not evolved. Meh. They get an extra star for consistency.

The food here is great and the vast selection of cheesecake is to die for. But I&#39;d say service is a hit or miss. The last time I came in, it was definitely a miss.  It wasn&#39;t very busy when my sister and I came in on a Monday night around 9:20. The hostess was friendly and seated us promptly outside. After 5-10 minutes of no one coming to our table, a different server came over with a couple waters and informed us that our server was a little backed up.  That was fine, I understand it can be easy to fall behind when tables want to check out at the same time or want their food boxed up. But then more time passed by and our server still hasn&#39;t approached our table at all(she even walked by a few times without acknowledging us).  No matter how backed up you are, all it takes is a few seconds to at the very least greet your table. When she finally came over to take our order(which took around 20mins), her attitude just wasn&#39;t very great. Even a simple &#34;sorry for the wait&#34; would&#39;ve made things better. During our meal, she was behind us with another employee griping about wanting to get phased. Well it definitely showed.  Overall, the food was good, but we felt neglected and the bad service really took away from everything. Our server might have just been having a bad day, but it was just one of those dining experiences you wouldn&#39;t want to put your family in.

Food is always good here! A bit pricey but it&#39;s a great place to splurge. It&#39;s romantic and has dim lighting but also good for kids. We were seated by the kitchen and it was very loud so I took a star away for that. If you want a quiet dinner, ask to be seated away from the kitchen. But you may not be able to be picky. The wait is always about an hour when we go.
Great service but $11.50 for a Long Island ice tea? Ridiculous. Just because it&#39;s &#39;skinny&#39; and/or brunch?! Not cool. Lovely restaurant and great waiter but way too spendy.

Food is decent. Not anything spectacular. Always super busy when I go. Not a place I&#39;d travel out of the way to eat at but good if you live in the area and wanna stop in for a quick bite. They have a good selection of healthier meals as well.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory and Alla was our server. Oh my god not only was the food amazing but the service was so fast and she was so knowledgeable about everything. I had no idea what I wanted to eat and took forever to decide but she was so patient even asking about my food interests, what I was in the mood for and if I had any allergies. I told her something Mediterranean and she instantly suggested three of her favorite things that would get that craving. She was so attentive, so sweet with all of our kids and even made sure to ask them how their food was and how they were doing. She knew all the paw patrol characters and the kids just loved her. She really knew her stuff and she was so fast frankly she must have wings cuz our food was flying out so fast!!! That woman is a goddess and a life saver if you ever go to Cheesecake Factory askfor Alla and bring a little extra cash cuz she&#39;s gonna earn every dime. Wow!

First off the started to seat us and then made us go back because they made a mistake.  Second I orders a hamburger no cheese.  When it came it had cheese.  We had no silverware no bread.  Worst place ever.  Will never go back.
Way to expensive for what you receive.  I know portions size is big, but customer service and prices are way to much for what anyone imagines.  They will rip you of both food and beverages!
There is no mozzarella sticks on the appetizer menu. Post meal, still no damn bread. &#34;It&#39;s in the oven&#34; the man says (for an hour and a half). Basics people, basics. #sickofthis

Great service! Great food! Our waiter was super nice and friendly. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Got my usual the baja chicken tacos and they were great as usual. The white chocolate peppermint bark Cheesecake!!! Yum!!

I had went for my birthday a couple months ago and went in a big party, I had went in a couple hours earlier (they were already so busy, line out to the door) and put my name on the list and when I came back they said that I was never on the list and were so rude about it, and I was bs because I had their buzzer... Not only was getting a table horrible but my service was not great as well.. my server tried her best and I don&#39;t blame her but our food had come out at different times and my friend even got the wrong the dish.. and had to wait another 20 minutes to get her meal.. just ridiculous to get seated and just to get food.

This was our first visit to this location in Happy Valley- very impressed! We were seated promptly considering it was Easter Sunday. Our waiter, Tom, was very helpful in assisting with the menu choosing among pages and pages of enticing options. The food came faster than expected, and exceeded our expectations. Overall, it was exemplary service and excellent food. Can&#39;t wait to go back!

Wait wasn&#39;t long at all. However food took forever and one plate took so long (lettuce wraps) that we all finished our food before it arrived. Then we were told they hoped we didn&#39;t want cheesecake because the bakery was super far behind on orders. Food is always good. Just not a very quick or relaxing place to eat.

I always look forward to eating at the Cheesecake Factory, I love the avocado egg rolls.  I took my family last night, my wife and I&#39;s anniversary.  I ordered the New York steak.   Well, my medium steak was taken to a different table as a rare steak.  At least they told me this as everyone else is eating except me but when I did get my steak 10 minutes after everyone else got theirs, the potatoes and green beans were so dry I could take a couple of bites.  They had to have been under the heat lamp while remaking my steak or changing the guys rare steak to my medium more likely.   I told the server, who offered to get me new potatoes to go since I was thru eating by that time but just didn&#39;t sound appetizing.   Our first time at the Clackamas Cheesecake Factory and maybe our last.  For $150 when 4 of the meals out of 6 were kids&#39; meals, just expected more.
I had a great experience here tonight wonderful Coconut lime chicken. My friend had wonderful salmon ! Big portions and the Adams peanut butter cheesecake was delicious!!!

Shitty shitty service. Took 3 hours to be seated on sunday. Took over an hour hour to bring out food. Burger was extra burnt. Had to ask waiter to refill our waters.  Appetizers came along with the meal not before.  They kept forgetting some of the items we ordered. The manager argues over a mistake they made on the order. Ew never want to come here again

5 stars due to the positive experience and service we received yesterday!  We reluctantly sat at the bar since the wait was a bit.  We were warmly greeted right away by Joe (i think that was his name).  The food was good, not out of this world, but tasty and portions were generous.  The salad had a bit too much dressing and fries came cold.  Joe was very busy tending to the entire bar area and fixing the bar drinks but stayed attentive and quickly offered to get mom warm fries.  A bit through the meal, I saw him realize she didn&#39;t have her fries and he personally ran from behind the bar to get her her hot fries.  Joe also spoke kindly about the employers of The Cheesecake factory which is so refreshing to hear that employers and employees alike are valued.  You don&#39;t hear those kind of compliments regarding employers often enough these days.  Thanks for a nice positive experience to our lunch outing!
The to go cheesecake counter was disorganized and to be honest a joke:/ not very capable abs not well trained staff. Not the usual Cheesecake Factory experience. Very disappointing

Wasn&#39;t a fan at all. Service was awful. Took 15 minutes just to get greeted, messed up something as simple as a salad, didn&#39;t get refills when asked. Also they placed a hot plate right in front of my child who&#39;s 18 months so reaches for everything. My pasta was crunchy and dry and my,boyfriends pizza was burnt and falling apart. I was so disappointed:/

Gathered for a birthday celebration for my grandson Bryson. I was the designated arrive early to place our name. At 5:25 I expressed my desire for a table of 11. I was asked to step to the side and the manager would provide me a timeline. Approximately 10 minutes later the manager stated &#34; it will be 3 hours.&#34; I asked if I could change my request to a table of 6 and a table of 5. The change was made and I was told it would be an hour. I asked if she( the adorable young girl putting in the information) had placed me in line according to my previous request, as they were told 40 minutes and 10 had already gone by. I was told no because it is first come no reservations are allowed.<br>Are you kidding me. This is a joke and a bad one, We opted to through in the towel.  There is a better way to do business.  Sadly they have such great cheesecake this yelp will do nothing to change a bad practice.

First, the good:<br>1. My dinner was excellent.<br>2. Water and bread came quickly. <br>3. Drinks were tasty. <br>4. We were seated quickly. <br>Boy, I wish there was more to say on the &#34;good&#34; side<br><br>On the middling side of the fence:<br>1. Waitress was nice, but WAAAYYY too chatty. <br>2. Food was priced reasonably. <br>3. Drinks were a bit on the expensive side. <br><br>The bad:<br>1. Our food took 35-40 minutes to get to the table after ordering, while other diners who were seated after us were already eating. <br>2. Wife&#39;s burger was not great, nor was it delivered as advertised, but she was famished, so she ate the patty only and two bites of her side salad. We told the waitress she was unhappy, but decided not to send it back due to time constraints. <br>3. When she came back to offer dessert menu we declined and asked to speak to the manager to voice our dissatisfaction with her meal. He came, we said our piece and he argued with us. Wife finally said she was DONE arguing and we just wanted the check immediately so we could go. <br>4. Getting the check took 10 more minutes. Wife was upset so I told her to go to the car and I would handle everything.<br>5. Got the check and I was amazed to find the manager had not comped the burger. Waitress offered cheesecake to appease us, but I declined, as we had already made it clear wife was gluten free, therefore, cheesecake is not possible. I placed my full 20% cash tip on the table and asked to speak to the manager once again as I was NOT going to pay for a meal that we were dissatisfied with. Manager came by, I said I was happy to pay for everything except the burger and he refused to comp, as she had eaten the patty. I told him that was all that was edible and said again that I would pay for everything but not the burger while holding my credit card right in front of him. Again, he refused. I told him we were at an impasse and he was forcing my hand to walk out without paying AT ALL if that was his decision, and still he refused to budge.  He told me to smile for the camera as I walked out so he could call security.  I told him he was being a dick, he then called ME the dick, so I got up, smiled for the camera and gladly walked away from a horrible experience. <br><br>Both the wife and I have well over thirty years of working in the food service industry in fine dining and upper casual establishments and I have never witnessed such a rude, unbending manager in all my years. Whatever happened to &#34;the customer is always right&#34;? Obviously, this particular Cheesecake Factory does not adhere to this edict.  As much as I was pleased with MY meal, I&#39;ll now find it difficult to return to this location to try another.  How unfortunate. It could have turned out completely differently had the manager been more customer-centric.

It started off terribly with them telling my fiance and I it was a 15 minute wait. Not bad....but 30 minutes go by and I see people that walking after us and they go to a table before us. When we finally get a table they completely forget about us and we don&#39;t get any service until 30 mins after sitting down. Food was bland and service was ok but not great. Cheesecake was good but we didn&#39;t get to try the one we wanted cause they were out. Never going to go back. It was not worth our time. Waste of time and money

Saturday night arrived at 5:50pm, Party of 7 for a birthday dinner, 4 adults 3 children, A total of 2-1/2 hour wait time before we were seated, after being there waiting for 1.5 hours we were being told every 15 minutes that &#34;we were next&#34; or &#34;the table is being set&#34;, we were finally seated, took another 20 min just to get the server to take our order, took another 15 minutes just to find out they were &#34;out&#34; of bread and a few other items on the menu, nobody who worked there could give us a straight answer on why everything was so unorganized, the manager and assistant manger are completely incompetent and rude, horrible customer service and the worst attitudes, won&#39;t be coming back ever, save yourself the frustration and take your business elsewhere.

Sooo happy they just opened this location! And of course they did not disappoint! Christy, our server, did a great job! She has an eye for details. Her and the host&#39;s upfront were delightful to interact with. Same great wonderful food you expect from Cheesecake Factory. Thanks everyone!!!

Posting a one star review because our recent trip last weekend was a bust. Not only did they quote us the wrong wait time (had to wait an extra 45 minutes past what we were originally quoted) but the chicken piccata was not good. The avocado egg rolls were good though, as always. My daughter had food poisoning from the dulce de leche cheesecake. Would have thought it was a fluke if someone else I know hadn&#39;t supported it with their own story of food poisoning from the cheesecake, too.

Went here on a Friday night and of course packed (plus it opened a couple weeks ago) but totally worth the wait! Their menu has a variety of dishes for meat eaters to vegan. My fiancé and I tried four cheese pasta, guacamole avocado salad, cauliflower honey bbq appetizer and pot sticker appetizer. All amazing especially the cauliflower appetizer. The cheesecake was lemon raspberry. Everything was awesome! Will go back! Plus when they seat you, you receive bread. :)

Very disappointing. Service was good and helpful but I came here for the Tuna Tartare appetizer (during lunch and it wasn&#39;t even packed) and they ran out of it. I drove out here from Vancouver just to eat here and mainly for that dish and was let down. I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll come back here again. The food here to me is mediocre.
Probably i was too expected of foods?<br>Cheese cakes are absolutely good but<br>I got lunch time spaghetti and pizza<br>Horrible taste... especially spaghetti was really bad

REEDEM YOURSELVES I DON&#39;T WANT TO LOSE YOU!<br>The Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favourite places. My family and I have been regulars for years at the Summerlin location as well as on the Strip. The employees at the Vegas locations embody everything that Cheesecake stands for (In my opinion). That being said...I have had some terrible experiences at this location. My first visit, I was there waiting for 3+hours. I understand some dishes got mixed up, you&#39;re busy with other tables, food comes out cold or whatever. That&#39;s a part of the food industry...things happen. BUT when it takes about 45 mins to get some water, I&#39;m confused. I have blocked out part of that experience, it was pretty bad. I am not a quitter though! I gave it another shot. The second time I went in I brought my family, this time it was the complete opposite problem. Everything was running very smoothly up until our waiter was telling us to &#34;hurry up&#34; because we were taking too long to order. He then WALKED AWAY WHILE WE WERE ASKING HIM A QUESTION...WALKED AWAY! He went to go talk to this girl who was another server she was on her phone by the POS system laughing and talking. We tried to get his attention after about 15 mins he came back and told us to order now. SO we tried again to ask him some questions he just said &#34;I don&#39;t know&#34; rolled his eyes. We were a little stunned. we just decided order. He then came back about an hour later saying they didn&#39;t have what we wanted...so we ordered something else. Thats fine. Our dinner came and went, he then threw our to-go boxes on the table and asked if we wanted dessert. Dessert is supposed to bring this already FABULOUS dining experience to a close. We went for it. Everyone ordered a piece of cheesecake, granted I do take a minute to decide what I want...HE RUSHED IT OUT OF ME. I TOLD HIM TO GIVE ME A MINTUE! He came back and I told him I was ready then he said &#34;oh now you&#39;re ready?&#34;. <br>Have a thick skin walking in...never thought I would say that. I&#39;ll return to the VEGAS locations...not too stoked about this one though. <br>THE BAKERS/CASHIERS (in the bakery section) ARE WHAT SAVE THIS LOCATION!
Good food and better desert! Service is a bit slow usually but the servers are always nice.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. My roommate and I live about 5 minutes drive away from this location and placed a delivery order through Grubhub at 11:45 am today. She received a message from The Cheesecake factory at 12:30pm saying the food wouldn&#39;t arrive till 1pm and they were throwing in some free food for taking so long. The food arrived at 1:03 pm and it was just my salad. A cold salad with nothing but lettuce, chopped veggies, some cheese and dressing. She ordered several appetizer items and none of her items were in the bag. She called both Grubhub and Cheesecake factory to complain Grubhub was wonderful and gave her a full refund. What was the Cheesecake factorys response? &#34; oh well we ran out so that&#39;s why we didn&#39;t send the rest of your order.&#34; A direct quote. Why wouldn&#39;t they send another message like they did before saying they were out of her items? Where is the &#34; free&#34; stuff that was supposedly coming with the food? Why did it take over an hour to send out a cold salad if they ran out of her items? By the way my salad was disgusting and had several pieces of dark brown salad going bad. You suck cheesecake factory and I hope you go out of business.

I have been to several Cheesecake Factories and I would always give 5 stars however this is the worst restaurant experience I have ever experienced.  First off our waiter was excellent and the food was good.  My rating is for the experience.  It starts by being out of two of the main dishes that 2 out of 4 of our table ordered on a Tuesday night being not available because they were out of steak.  ??  So two of us ordered something else which included myself.  My buddy ordered a drink and we he took a sip he cut his lip on the glass that had a crack about a 1/4 of the way around the top of the glass.  So after his lip was bleeding we finally got the manager over to replace the drink.  Food service was slow and when the food showed up, everyone received their order except my buddy who had cut his lip and he was told they ran out of mashed potatoes and they would be brought out once they made more.  He was given French fries to hold him over with his meal.  Once he and everyone was done eating, the mashed potatoes showed up.  Needless to say we had enough at this point and the Cheesecake we hoped to have after our meal, was not going to happen. The manager did initially comp part of my buddies meal at first and once he was advised of the multiple incidents to start off with that we couldn&#39;t order what we wanted, his meal was fully comped.  I think a little more should have been done but it is what it is.  Not likely to return.

Can&#39;t actually comment on food because I&#39;ve never had the patience to wait 40+ minutes for a table. Came by tonight to see about 20 open tables and still a 30+ min wait!! Why?? They shut down tables because they had a couple bigger parties to handle and they were admittedly understaffed.  What a joke!  Skip this place entirely and go to Nordstrom&#39;s cafe. Food and service are excellent and there is usually NO wait!!!

First time going to the cheesecake factory, and let me say it was not a good experience. Waited 1 hour for a seat for 2. Then waited almost as long for our food. When I was ready to order cheesecake to go I asked to have my meal boxed up and instead of just giving me a box, the waitress had someone else take it to get boxed. He comes back and told me that my food was thrown out instead of boxed. A pasta that was almost 20$ and half left was thrown out. Then he tells me to talk to my waitress when I asked about getting a new one or getting alittle taken off my bill. The waitress comes and tells me she will talk to her manager and see what he says, the manager who&#39;s name was David as I later found out gave me 3$ off a 20$ pasta. When instead of being boxed up for a customer was thrown out. So I just go and order my cheesecake and leave. I get home and go to eat my cheesecake and open the box to find a half eaten steak and mash potatoes. So I call and ask for the manager. After having a discussion with him over the cheesecakes he tells me he will give me the money back. I call to see and he only put 1 cheesecake back on my card, so I call back again and I&#39;m told by the manager David that he only seen one and he can&#39;t do nothing more. When I have the receipt and it clearly has 2 cheesecakes on it. Horrible customer service and a horrible experience. Will be talking to the higher ups about it.<br><br>Edit- I got both cheesecakes refunded. Still was not a delightful experience.

Service is horrible. They told us it will be a 30-45 minute wait, waited for 1 hour and 15 minutes. After the waiter finally decided to show up and take our order, we waited for another 45 minutes to get our food. Waiter was annoyed from the simplest request. Music is loud, the place is small and the service is horrible.
Great visit to Cheesecake Factory. Food quality and wait times are much better than the one at Washington Square in Tigard.

Great experience today. Came in after a husband wife date day. Had the egg rolls and salad with two glasses of wine. Fantastic service from Lloyd. Usually go to Washington Square location but I think our new favorite is Llord and the Clackamas Town Center location. Thanks Lloyd!!

Worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at Cheesecake Factory. Hoping it&#39;s because it&#39;s a brand new location at Clackamas Town Center and they&#39;re still working out the kinks. We walked in and was told it would be a 20 minute wait (even though there were several empty tables) or we could sit in the bar. We proceeded to a table in the bar and sat down. A waitress immediately told us we couldn&#39;t sit there. I explained that the gal at the front told us we could. Not even 15 seconds later, another waitress came back with the first one in tow, to tell us we couldn&#39;t sit there. I again explained that we were told we could sit in the bar. Long story short, we just got up and left, instead of arguing with the 2 ladies! So sad, because I was hoping to have my birthday dinner there later this month. I don&#39;t know what the big deal was, especially since there were several available tables in the restaurant and in the bar!!

This review is for Amy the manager, unfortunately our stay was cut short due to our appetizer the delicious Tex mex egg rolls, before my spouse bit into the second one we seen a &#34;hair like&#34; string hanging off the waiter watched us pull it off.. he proceeded to take it from us and we asked if it was a hair and his response was &#34;looks like it&#34; he walked off and said he would handle this immediately, he then stated his manger would come over and helped us expeditiously, Amy came over and asked us what happens we told her and we ask if we can just get a fresh batch because it didn&#39;t sit well with us and she said &#34;Not for free, you can pay for another batch even if you don&#39;t finish these&#34; I said and why is that she said because &#34;I know it wasn&#39;t a hair&#34;  being that you have no laboratory in the back to check the easier thing to do was to just replace the egg rolls with fresh ones and so we can get ready for us pasta plates. I asked for her name and she left. The nice waiter came back and asked if she took care of it and we said no, and decided to leave because it&#39;s simple customer service I come from a family of restaurant owners and we would never do that because we take pride in our food!  Regardless if you think it isn&#39;t a hair or not just for the customers sake. He than said that&#39;s weird she should&#39;ve and brought another manager and after telling her the story for the 3rd time we lost our appetite by now and decided to leave we asked for receipt to pay for egg rolls and she said I can&#39;t make you pay for those and offered fresh ones we politely declined. And there you have it all of this for what?  Something so simple went on for 20 mins because the manager didn&#39;t &#34;believe the customer was right&#34; it&#39;s a simple task.. maybe next time you&#39;ll make customers feel like there appreciated.. Thank a lot to the wonderful waiter and kind 2nd manager... hope there&#39;s not a lot of &#34;Amy&#39;s&#34; working you&#39;ll lose out on a lot of revenue. Have a good day!

Worst service ever this is the second time I go there and they manage to treat customers like garbage. They look to see who is more likely to give a big tip and when they see someone without brand clothing expected we can&#39;t give a tip. When we arrived they took 30 minutes then asked us what kind of drink we wanted then with no bread I was like fine then the guy switched our server because he didn&#39;t want to take our order. And I told my family we were leaving because we were going to spend money on a b.s place that doesn&#39;t respect there customers. And the only reason they came up was because I popped up the yelp add because they knew it wasn&#39;t right.
2 PM on a Saturday and no wait. Factory chop salad chicken avocado club and Cuban sand were awesome. Very friendly staff.

Not worth it. I&#39;m the guy that almost always leaves great reviews. I&#39;m not the &#34;debbie downer&#34; type. But, this latest visit was disappointing, to put it lightly. The food was as expected, leaning towards &#34;meh.&#34; The service and staff were disorganized. Starting from the beginning, we were told it&#39;d be an hour wait, which is to be expected for a premium restaurant. We arrived at 6:00pm on a Saturday night. We were seated around 7:20pm. We asked the hostess for a high-chair, and she said she was grabbing one, but it never came.  After being seated and realizing a high-chair wasn&#39;t coming, we asked a random staff member to grab one for us.  Our waitress was Mariah.  She was friendly, but obviously overwhelmed.  Not her fault.  She was doing her best and hustling all night.  We didn&#39;t have to wait very long for our food.  My father-in-laws Fish and Chips came out slightly cold and greasy.  I decided to go all out and ordered the Filet Mignon with Erath Vineyards Pinot Noir.  We received our entrees, but my filet did not include a steak knife.  Actually, there were no knives on the table.  We buttered our bread with our spoons and forks.  I was almost done with my potatoes and green beans before we were able to flag down another random staff member to bring us a steak knife for my filet.  Once Mariah returned...(it appeared she was having a problem with an eight-top across from us who kept sending their food back to the kitchen)...but after she finally returned, she realized we had not received the Pinot Noir...which I wanted to pair with my filet.  She rushed it out to the table, but...by this point...we were halfway thru dinner.  My in-laws were disappointed at the fragmented dinner service, because no one wants to start eating dinner until everyone is ready.  And while waiting on a steak knife, and then the Pinot...we all seemed to be eating at different times.  For a premium price, this visit didn&#39;t own up to the cost...and unfortunately...we&#39;re likely to choose somewhere else next time.  The experience was so hectic and disorganized, I doubt I would reconsider a second-chance.  Had I checked Yelp first, I may not have gone at all to begin with.  I wish the location and future patrons better luck in the future.
Very sad to get fish and chips to go with no tartar sauce. Can do without ketchup for the fries but NO tartar sauce? Really?  No lemon? What???

And I&#39;m being nice because the service and the waitress was amazing. The food..... not so much. My niece ordered chicken tenders and it was 90% batter.... I ordered tater tot appetizers and they were so soggy. I didn&#39;t catch the girls name but she was super sweet and attentive. I hope she kept the full tip.

Service from other people say that it&#39;s very slow. But in my recent experience, it was fast, but a little too fast. We sat down within 5 minutes. Got our water and some bread to eat. We placed our order and then decided to go check out what cheesecake to have for dessert. We got back to our table about 3 minutes later and our table was cleared off. Only thing left on the table was a salt and pepper shaker. I guess they didn&#39;t notice the jacket sitting on the bench.  We asked the for order was still in the kitchen they said yes. But after seeing that the table next to us ordering the same time as we did already had their meal. And we waited another 15 minutes or so. So they probly had to re order. Even though the food there is so so, love the cheesecake. Service was super super super fast for the 1st 15 minutes. I didn&#39;t think they had to turn tables that fast. Mentioned to the host and they said meh, oh well.
HUGE menu. I prefer happy hour just because you can try lots of small plates from the length menu. Of course you have to get some cheesecake to go with all their choices.

Had a really good experience! Took my gal out for a late lunch. We were sat immediately. I had the steak Diane which was amazing! Definitely recommend it. My gal had the New York steak. Great flavor, but I have to knock off a star because she wanted it cooked medium rare and it arrived medium well. It was also a very thinly cut steak. Overall, we were both pleased and will definitely be back. Glad they opened at this location!

We ate here on a Friday night and it was packed. We were told a 45 minute wait, they gave us one of those alert buzzers and we wondered off. Their wait estimate was close -about 40 minutes in, our buzzer went off and we were seated in a two person booth. (Note: the booth was small and there&#39;s no coat hooks). The overall feel of the restaurant felt small to me, verging on uncomfortable. Prepare yourself to yell-speak. You&#39;ll walk out of there to the parking lot&#39;s &#34;quiet&#34; and realize how all the noise made your ears numb. I also didn&#39;t like that they let people waiting pretty much wonder through the whole front of the restaurant. It&#39;s like you gotta fight to get in and fight to get out. We had two friendly servers (one was shadowing the other for training). We ordered two chicken pasta dishes- one good, the other okay. Cheesecake was yummy (we had the Godiva). Overall, if you can deal with the craziness of the atmosphere then try it. But for me, I can&#39;t say it&#39;s worth going back.
Service was very slow. Took forever to get our food and they are way over priced for what you get.

With only a party of four it took about two hours to get our food. We were never told it would take that long. I had my 2 year old daughter with me and she was hungry. I had to ask the waitress how much longer because my little one was hungry and it seemed like she was avoiding us and walking away when I would ask her questions. The food was ok but am pretty disappointed in the service. It kind of ruined my Cheesecake Factory experience that I&#39;m used to having at Washington Square. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back. As for all the terrible reviews on here..,.I am a business owner myself and don&#39;t take them lightly. This is my first bad review I&#39;ve ever given... do to the customer service and lack of care showed by the management.  It&#39;s concerning to see all the negative reviews and see the same response from the management.  It seems they may need new management.  It&#39;s not the staff... it comes from the management. Good luck!

We have always loved cheesecake factory and it has been a go to for me and my husband on date night. We decided to take my family out for a nice brunch and specifically chose CF because my son has an egg allergy, and I figured that they would be able to accommodate us since most places we go that are big chains have direct access to their ingredients. I trusted the server when I asked what menu items my son could eat specifically wondering about breads, pasta and pizza. I had told my son that he would be able to have some sort of toast since most breads do not have eggs in them. I was surprised when the server came back to tell me that all of the food that I inquired about had eggs in it...my son was stuck eating a side of avocado, side of potatoes and a small bowl of fruit. I decided to look more into this because it didn&#39;t seem correct and to my surprise I found out that all of the items that I had specifically asked about were actually vegan (egg free). I cannot believe that the kitchen staff and my server would be so negligent and not try to accommodate me or my family. It was so sad not being able to order anything for my son and being that he is only two he does not understand why everyone else around him is eating and he&#39;s not allowed to eat anything. Never again, heartbreaking.
Told would be 55 minutes. 2 hours later we still were not seated!  Will reserve judgment until get our food. Wonder how long that will take.

We were highly disappointed with our very short experience tonight. A friend of ours is in town from California and being that none of us have been here before, we hoped for a great night out. We were wrong. We arrived here around 8pm, and two of our party members arrived separately and each put their name down. One of them got a 50 minute wait-time quote, and the other got no quote at all. We had been sitting down waiting patiently and enjoying each other&#39;s company for only about 10-15 minutes when the manager came over to greet us, and told us that now, given the amount of large parties that are seated right now, it was estimated a 4 1/2 - 5 HOUR wait time. His name is Ashton. He spoke to us in a very condescending tone, and given that we were a group of 7 young adults with a baby, we very strongly feel that the estimation he gave us was EXTREMELY exaggerated. Never before have I ever received a wait time of more than an hour and a half. We are extremely disappointed in him for speaking to us the way he did. It gave us no reason to doubt that he only said that in hopes that we would leave, given that a party of 7 should not have to wait 5 HOURS at 8pm to get a table. We ALL work in customer service, and we know that there is absolutely no way that every single table sitting in that restaurant was going to stay at their table for over 4 more hours. No way. Extremely irritated and disappointed with how he treated us.

I had ordered take out and received the wrong thing. Contacted the manager Eddie and he was amazing to work with and compensated me for the mess up . Was very easy going to work with and will 100% be going back due to this great experience.  Thank you Eddie !
They do not take reservations for large groups. Come on people we need to be smarter no restaurant is worth an hour or more wait. There are too many good options out there.
Jeremy was the best waiter we had ever had! The food was amazing.... so happy to have found this location!

As a HUGE Cheesecake Factory fan, I was extremely disappointed with our first experience here last week. We had a larger party (13) but called ahead (at 1pm) and went early to check in at 2:15. We were told we had to speak to a manager due to our parties size... then we<br>were told about a 1-2 hour wait (which is a large time slot window but we were ok waiting a bit). At 4:45 (2 1/2 hours later) we were finally seated. It went from bad to worse. Service was ok, didn&#39;t seem to hurry to get us ordered or bring anything. We waited for bread, waited even longer for drinks and then apps. Our drinks were empty and all apps/bread gone LONG before our food finally arrived. We finally got out of there at 6:45 (2 HOURS after sitting down) and didn&#39;t even want to eat dessert. I ordered a piece of cheesecake to go and was told a manager would have to add it to our bill because they&#39;d totaled it already. Very weird. I would not recommend this location because the management/service/wait time. Also the food was smaller portioned than past cheesecake experiences. Maybe once they get better service/management or have been there some time I might try it again. Not worth the time commitment!

Let me start off by saying that I am typically a major fan of The Cheesecake Factory and writing this review is disheartening. I love their menu and their atmosphere. The location in Washington Square Mall turned me on to the place, however this location seems to be slacking. I have been three times since this location has opened and sadly each time seems to go worse than the last. I understand that this is a new location and it takes some time to get the gears in motion, however I think that the grace period for that has ended. All three times I attended, I have had friendly service. The hosts/hostesses and servers are pleasant. The food is usually decent as well, especially for being a chain restaurant. What I am not a fan of, however, is their lack of attention. The first two times, I recall waiting for the server for upwards of 10 minutes after being seated and nearly 30 minutes waiting for the bill.
